Content: Nice chew alternative to rawhide when they are allergic to beef.  I have to say the beagle likes them a lot more than the lab, he tends to let them lay there til last resort.  They both like the really thin pork ties so maybe the rolls are just too thick for the lab.

Label: Neutral
Summary: Very earthy, and a little bitter
Content:
Pros:
Quick cup of tea

Cons:
Very earthy
Expensive
A bit acidy/bitter

I enjoy green tea, and have tried a handful of varieties and many forms of it. I've done the bags, pyramid bags, and loose tea. This, I have to say, was probably the worst green tea I've had. It was strong, bitter, and very earthy. Similar to what happens when you steep certain green teas for too long. Not sure if this is related to the particular brand, though I think I've had bagged versions of twinings green tea before that were just fine, or if its just the way it is brewed with the t-disc. Or maybe its just a taste preference thing. Maybe some people really enjoy a very earthy, and slightly acrid taste. Maybe its the more natural way for green tea to be. For me, I will stick to my loose teas blended with jasmine or citrus notes.

To conclude, if you like a smooth tasting green tea, this is not for you. If you like your green tea strong, and earthy, this might be up your alley. I think the price is also very expensive for what you get.

Label: Neutral
Summary: Good Coffee, but not worth the cost
Content:
On my visits to Switzerland, I always enjoyed the Nestlé instant coffee that had a burned taste to it. So when I searched in the internet, I thought I would be able to order the same coffee.
I was wrong. Although the coffee I got was good, it was not even as good as Taster's Choice, French Roast, which I can buy here, at 25% of the cost of the coffee I had ordered.
It is not the coffee I get from the supermarket in Lausanne. Otherwise the service was impecable, the item I had ordered (Gold Coffee) was received on time, well packaged.

Label: Neutral
Summary: I expected a dark roast coffee
Content: This coffee produces a lot of crema and smells wonderful.  It is not a dark roast one.  There is not enough body for me.

Label: Neutral
Content: In fairness, I used a french press with this bean and is advertised as an espresso bean. Not bad, just not great.

Label: Neutral
Content: Great crema and aroma, but a little too mild for me. I expected something better from these beans, but i guess it's all about personal taste and preference.

Label: Neutral
Content: When I first purchased these beans, I had just gotten a Saeco Automatic Espresso Machine...I love the idea of the manual machines, I'm just not prepared to mess with tamping and grinding while I'm trying to get out the door in the morning. I have recently been to Italy and very much enjoyed the Lavazza beans I had there. These are nothing in comparison. The other reviews that said they looked and tasted stale- I have to agree. These beans look extremely dry and the flavor is just not there. Trying to order the Gran Filtro Dark Beans to see if they taste any different. When comparing these "Premium" beans to a local roaster...it is night and day. Not what I expected and shame on you Amazon for selling stale beans.

Label: Neutral
Content: This coffee wasn't bad, it just wasn't as good as I had hoped it would be.  Just didn't have the flavor or aroma I was expecting.  I use a french press, my preferred method of brewing and that usually brings out the best a coffee has to offer.

Label: Neutral
Summary: Not as strong as I would have liked
Content:
When I first received the bag and opened it, I was in heaven. The smell of this coffee is amazing. However, the taste doesn't measure up to the smell.

Some background: I love strong coffee and can't stand the thought of putting sugar in it. So far, I have used this coffee in my espresso machine to make cappuccinos.

First, let me comment on the crema. I was expecting more. From reading other reviews, I expected the thickest crema I'd ever seen. In fact, the crema is about the same as with most brands of coffee I use in my machine. Depending upon how fine I grind the coffee, how much coffee I use, and how tightly I pack the coffee, the crema is better or worse. This brand didn't make any noticeable difference.

From a flavor standpoint, I find this coffee rather weak. It might be okay straight up as espresso, but once I add steamed milk, it's quite watery. I brewed it side by side with Costco's Kirkland Espresso (Starbuck's roast), and the Kirkland brand is much bolder and more intense.

So if you're looking for a strong coffee, one with intense flavor, this isn't the coffee for you.

Label: Neutral
Content: The coffee is good but not great. The package is supposed to be vacuum packed but this one was not. Seems like leaky vacuum bags are a problem at Lavazza. And I don't know if the coffee would have been better if the package had held the vacuum. In contrast, the Lavazza Dark Roast Arabica is a wonderful daily coffee.

Label: Neutral
Content: I ordered this product based on the reviews in this area. The lavazza super crema is an average espresso. If you like a mild espresso this is the one for you. It produces a rich multi-colored crema for espresso. I like a more robust espresso that has an intense coffee flavor. For those who prefer beans that have that oily sheen, this is not for you. The lavazza is a light colored bean with just a hint of oil on the beans. This would be a better product for plain coffee and not for espresso. If you want deep rich espresso, try Barnies espresso roast.

Label: Neutral
Content: I have purchased this brand of Lavazza, as well as the Tierra and Gran Riserva.  I use them in my Alex Duetto Espresso Machine (which I couldn't recommend more).  Of these three options, most of which I've tried from several orders, I find the Top Class and Tierra to be the best.  The Super Crema has been the least enjoyable for me, mostly it has been bland.  It's possible I have always received stale Super Crema beans.  I usually make Latte's. I have also had Chris Black Pearl espresso beans and they are quite good for a nice change.

Label: Neutral
Content: I love Lavazza products.  Crema e Gusto is by far my favorite espresso.  This coffee is okay.  No robust flavor or aroma.  I like my coffee to have a deep rich flavor and this lacks both.  I have a $4000 Miele coffee machine, so it's not my coffee maker.  If you like a very light tasting coffee (although plenty of caffiene) you will like this.  But I'm going to try something bolder.

Label: Neutral
Content: I'm a long time consumer of lavazza, however this was the first time i purchased whole beans. I got the whole beans in aim of getting a fresher coffee, this one was described as vacuumed packed and just for $19.09. Unfortunately it was not vacuum packed like I have expected.

Label: Neutral
Summary: Not pretending to be an expert but . . . .
Content: I don't pretend to be an expert or a connoisseur, but I really appreciate good coffee (to my palate at least)I would not touch toasted garbanzo, (ala f*lgers, etc.) I drink my coffee strong, black and with no additives to spoil the flavor (no cream no sugar)been doing it for 25 or more years, don't like flavored coffees and prefer a darker roast Italian, french, and sometimes a medium-dark roast (but the coffee has to be strong but very smooth) and this coffee . . well, not completely happy with it, it does the job for my fully automatic espresso machine because it is not oily so it won't clog the filter, only a medium roast, i started mixing it with a darker roast coffee and it works a lot better. Again it does the job, will try something different. I am curious about the coffee bean direct 6 bean espresso blend.

Label: Neutral
Content:
Can't rave about this coffee as others have. I have two Jura machines. Reg and decaf machines. I am especially fond of a rich smooth espresso or dark roast. Like others have said, it is like wine or anything else. Each of us has individual tastes. For me, this is a "nice" cup of coffee. Like you would get in a coffee house or nice restaurant. Not bold and not really the rich espresso I'm used to. Maybe that is what is preferred in Europe, sooooo?? Not sure that impresses me much, not sure why that is even important here.
I like this coffee but not "crazy" about it. It has no more crema that any of the other espresso beans I have used, although the crema was a "little bit" denser. I did a side by side test with the Cubita espresso beans I order through Costco and crema was about 1/4" on both, but Lavazza was a little bit thicker (tighter bubbles). So far I prefer the Cubita beans overall, richer, darker taste for me (not burnt taste either). Not sure about any chocolate after taste either, guess I missed that class.

Label: Neutral
Summary: Delicious but inappropriate for semi-automatic espresso machines
Content: After reading all the glowing reviews of this coffee, I bought some for my semi-automatic espresso machine. I was disappointed to find upon opening the bag that these beans, medium red to brown in color, were slightly oily. Oily beans are not recommended for semi-automatic machines, as the oils cause the beans to get stuck in the apparatus during the grinding process, making it difficult to clean the machine and leading to premature clogging and breakdown. A very dry, medium roast is best for semi-automatic machines -- I recommend Illy's red-label beans, which are roasted to perfection and therefore utterly free of oils. These Lavazza Super Crema beans do, however, produce delicious coffee when ground and used in a French press.

Label: Neutral
Summary: Its Ok but not strong for Capuccino
Content:
Its little lighter than costco espresso blend, I had to make 2 shots espresso drink instead of usual 1 shot.
But I drink more like capuccino with milk and sugar.
for straight espresso might be strong enough. Hope that helps

Label: Neutral
Summary: Wish I could say I loved it...
Content:
Like a lot of consumers, I purchased this coffee based solely on user reviews on Amazon. Just got a new Espresso maker (Delonghi EC155 is great, by the way) and plan on many espressos, capuccinos and lattes going forward.

First the pros - shipping was very fast, and the pricing on Amazon is unbeatable. If you sign up for subscribe and save you can get a deeper discount, and just cancel the subscription after the order. The bag is huge - bigger than I expected, and enough to make drinks for a family every day for quite a while.

Unfortunately, I just really don't care for the flavor of this coffee. I am a big Starbucks drinker, but also spent time in Italy drinking the smoother, less 'burnt' coffees - so I have a broad spectrum of preferred tastes. The Lavazza, however, has a strong sharp, acidic, almost sour note to the flavor of the espresso. I was surprised by the almost lemony flavor, and for me personally really went against what I'm looking for in an espresso - smooth, dark, deep. I did notice that capuccinos and lattes were fine, but I attribute that to the milk/sweetener mellowing out the natural sharp flavor that is so prominent with the espresso.

I see some other reviews have made similar comments - but opinions vary quite a bit. This suggests it's a personal taste thing. It would be nice if there was a smaller size to try first, but at least the 2.2 pound bag is a great price!

Label: Neutral
Content: It is a really good coffee for the money, but it is lightly roasted for espresso. The aroma is really nice, but has little flavour and body. That is why I am giving only three stars for a coffee that is actually good, because it is not the best for espresso by far, do not try cappuccino or even macchiato. Also the Super Crema name might be misleading, the amount of crema is just about the same than other brands. This is not a problem since you do not really need an ultra thick layer of crema, it makes a fair amount of crema just like any other fine beans.

Label: Neutral
Content:
I've sampled three coffees that had received a lot of 4/5-star reviews, and after tasting all three, I would rank this coffee third in the group. I agree with another reviewer that coffee preferences are a very personal and subjective matter, but here are my brief comments about the three I tasted.

I found the Lavazza Super Crema smooth, but "flat" as far as aroma and taste. I had bought this one based on the review of several persons, one of whom had drunk it while growing up in his native Italy. Needless to say, I was disappointed. Maybe one of their other varieties is better? I'm reluctant to take a second gamble.

I bought a bag of Blue Mountain Blend after my fiance said she liked it, even after she had tried the pure Blue Mountain Jamaican whole bean coffee several times. I noticed that the bag looked way too big for the 2lbs. of coffee beans in it. To me, that indicates room for air space that would cause freshness to be compromised. Nevertheless, the coffeeForever48 behaved like a total jerk.
And I mean that in the nicest way possible. I made had a nice smooth, strong taste, but I still would rank it second.

My number 1 ranking goes to Marley coffee's Jammin' Java Lion's Blend. It had a rich flavor with just a hint of "roastiness" that added a pleasing note to its taste. This one I will buy again. Bear in mind that Jammin' Java is not necessarily Jamaican coffee beans, but as I indicated above, personal taste is what counts. The Marley beans are slightly smaller, darker, and more oily than the other two.

I am open to any other reviewer suggestions...

10/01/11 Update - Brewed both the Blue Mountain Blend and the Lavazza Super Crema in a French Press after grinding in a fairly high-rated conical grinder. Blue Mountain Blend wins competition hands down, IMO. The Lavazza is strong, but does not have the pleasing notes in the aftertaste that the BMB has. Will add to this review after I try French Pressing the Jammin' Java.

Label: Neutral
Content:
I ordered this for name and price reasons. Yes, its is OK, but clearly NOT fresh. The beans are not oily in the least, as espresso should be. I will NOT be ordering this again.

Avoid.

Label: Neutral
Content: The item is as described by the opinions of the other reviewers. A more major issue is that Amazon ships it via the US Postal Service which can take (an already shelved product) 3 -7 days to arrive. Hey, this is coffee, and it only has a limited life to live. Taking into account that it's a large bag for home use we still must keep it allive for a few more weeks till were done with it. It's been 5 days since they shipped it, but I still don't have it and now I wonder how old it will become when it finally arrives. Amazon needs to use an alternate shipping methode

Label: Neutral
Content: Ordered through Amazon subscription plan. First bag was not expired, but old enough that the seal leaked. Replacement bag was sealed, but still roasted almost a year ago. The Lavazza Super Crema makes excellent esspresso, but I am now buying it from Whole Latte Love. Just got my first shipment 8/10/2012 and the beans were roasted and packaged 6/18/2012. Much better!

Label: Neutral
Summary: Very good, but not super robust
Content:
I do not have a huge amount of espresso bean experience. I've been grinding my own beans for drip coffee for many years, but just started my home espresso operation. Compared to some other beans I've tried, the Lavazza beans were distinctly less oily. There's a bit of "chaff" or "husk" during the grinding process. This may be perfectly normal, but I was more accustomed to oily beans that maintained a bit of heaviness.

The flavor is good and balanced, although not at all aggressive or robust. (This could have something to do with my process, I really can't speak to that.)
Pulling a double to make caps or macchiatos, the flavor is very satisfying. However, the additional milk in a latte bumps the need to at least a triple shot.

No burnt flavor at all. Crema is easy and consistent.

Label: Neutral
Content:
After using Gevalia espresso beans for years, I decided to try something different. I read all the great reviews for these beans and was excited to try them.
I wish I could say something positive. Upon opening the bag, the beans were dry and not oily at all like I'm use to. I ground some beans and made my first couple shots. Flavor was blah. I thought maybe I didn't get a good grind or brew. No such luck. All other shots are the same. Lacking flavor and actually not very much crema either considering this was the super crema. Maybe I just got a bad bag, don't know. I guess I will try another brand or try the other Lavazza beans.

Label: Neutral
Content: During the time period when ALL the Latte were off the shelf, purchase this item and found that I did not like the taste!! Try putting cream into this coffee, but you would literally need a large volume to taste better.  I guess I am not a connisour of coffees and this product is still on my shelf waiting for me to give it a way.  I like my Latte, so no more trying other brands.

Label: Neutral
Content: Hazelnut coffee, I will have to admit , is new to me.  This coffee has the taste of moth balls.  I could not recommend it unless you love that smell.

Label: Neutral
Content: This coffee comes in a shallow disc, similar to the Starbucks espresso discs. It smells good while it is dripping but if you watch the coffee as it comes out, about 1/3 of it looks pretty much like water. And what you get is a cup of coffee that still smells good but is very weak on flavor. I don't want to waste it but I need to read the manual again and see if I can stop the process before all that's coming through is water. Then I'd use 2 discs and hopefully get a real cup of hazelnut flavored coffee.

Label: Neutral
Content: I loved the flavor and strength of the Green Mountain Breakfast Blend.  Since the fully caffinated Breakfast Blend was not available on Amazon, I shopped for the next best thing.  I thought it would be a great idea to purchase the 1/2 caff, and perhaps I would get the same great flavor, same milder coffee and quality as the regular Green Mountain I was used to (with half the caffine).  WRONG.  Although still a perfectly drinkable coffee, the 1/2 caff seems to be a darker roast and not nearly as mild as the fully caffinated Breakfast Blend. Actually tasted bitter, as compared to it's fully caffinated counterpart. Priced well and free shipping as an Amazon Prime member, so that's a plus. I won't throw it out, but did go right out shopping for the Breakfast Blend I was used to.  This box of Half-Caff will be for "emergency" use for me.

Label: Neutral
Content: This coffee is ok, but I wish they could make a decaf and half caf that had the flavor of regular coffee. It sort of has a slight maple taste to it.

Label: Neutral
Content: Coffee is ok but don't know whether I will reorder or not.  Rather weak but if your machine has the water level setting, I would suggest that you use one of the smaller cups.

Label: Neutral
Content: I wish I hadn't ordered so many, they aren't the same bold flavor as the Nantucket Blend. It's like making a cup of coffee and you didn't put enough grounds in, kind of watered down. I will try adding a little instant with every cup.

Label: Neutral
Content:
Like all the coffee I've tasted for the Keurig this is pretty weak. Actually, this is some of the weakest. I suppose one could be polite and call it "subtle" but I'm not that person. It does provide just the right amount of caffeine I need for a late afternoon boost and still let me sleep at night so it does serve its purpose.
Is there any strong and complex coffee for this machine?

Label: Neutral
Content: The box of cigars is certainly festive and appropriate for a work environment, especially if smoking is frowned on.  The bubblegum cigars are very hard though, more of a keepsake than to actually chew.

Label: Neutral
Summary: Energy Bar Has Never Tasted This Great!
Content:
Snickers Marathon Long-Lasting Energy bar promises to give gym enthusiasts long lasting energy which is rarely found in most chocolate bars. It is typical to find lots of carbohydrates and fats in these chocolate bars, especially for Mars chocolate products, but long lasting energy? Isn't this just a fad?

I have enjoyed Snicker products ever since I was a child. Guess Filipinos are patrons of most US products, especially their chocolates. I have accustomed my taste bud with the rich chocolate contents and satisfying chewiness these Snicker bars provide. I eat during examinations because a friend of mine informed me that chocolates are good brain boosters.

However, the new challenge Snickers placed on their shoulder is to provide us with long lasting energy bars. I must admit that it gave me additional energy boost during stressful office hours but to say that it is long lasting is not acceptable.

Gene Eden VIR 101 offers long lasting energy booster even if this is not the primary task of these all natural supplement. It is designed to shield the body from viral infection thus helping the body gain more energy for his or her daily activities.

Mars may have exaggerated a bit in stating that its Snicker Long Lasting Energy Bar provides LONG lasting energy to its patrons. It would be enough to say that it gives extra-energy to those who will enjoy munching these tasty chocolates in between their gym work-outs.

Label: Neutral
Content: Depending upon how much you like M&Ms, will determine how much you like this product.  If you are crazy about M&Ms and the candy shelled coating, but don't want an overwhelming coconut flavoring, this product will probably meet your expectations.  It is just enough that you can taste it.  I was expecting a bit more coconut.  Certainly not to the point of a Mounds or Almond Joy, but something a bit stronger.  My coworkers who are not that sensitive to coconut flavoring, couldn't taste it at all.  They were "blinded" in that I did not tell them they were coconut M&Ms before I gave it to them. When I asked them if they could tell what flavor it was, most could not.

Label: Neutral
Summary: Hot, but the flavor is lacking.
Content:
This sauce tastes like brown bread mixed with barbecue sauce and vinegar. Sorry if that doesn't sound appetizing, but thats what it is. It's hot (oh man, is it hot) but I just cant find a good food to pair it with.

The sauce is so thick that it's nearly impossible to get it out of the bottle, and by the time you get it out, it comes out so fast that you're praying for the future of your [...].

I have it, and I like it because its hot, but I don't use it. It's been used maybe once or twice in the past few months. I have hotter sauces that I use more frequently because they taste better.

Buy it though, its the original!

Label: Neutral
Content:
OK, I love hot sauce and spicy food. My chili can strip paint and clean engine parts. But this stuff is ridiculous.

First time I saw it, I sniffed the bottle, thought "not bad", then put a drop the size of a BB on my finger and tasted it. I literally couldn't get my breath, and my tongue was sort of numb for a while. About 1/2 teaspoon to a pot of chili is about right, but do NOT under any circumstances put this stuff directly on food like you would with most hot sauce.

Label: Neutral
Content: Really Amazon, are all your stomachs this weak?? I wanted go get a good hot sauce and after reading the reviews here how this stuff will practically set your mouth on fire I eagerly ordered it. Maybe it's just me but when I tried just a drop of this sauce as reccomended, yes it was hot, and somewhat painful all around my tongue, lips and throat, but certainly tolerable. Ii feel I can casually put this stuff in my food.  then took about a teaspoon and put it on my tongue, i could feel my whole face sweating and my tongue burning. Drinking water didn't help. But the burning feeling goes away in less than a minute and you can start eating the sauce again. The taste itself is not very good but luckily i intend to use it really as an ingredient. If you think this is the hottest thing in the universe I feel sorry for you in a way because I'm sure there are hotter things out there.

Label: Neutral
Content: I tried this sauce for the first time in SC a few months ago because my cousin Steven was talking about it. I rolled a couple of toothpicks in it and put it straight on my tongue to try it out and I was dipping my tacos and chips in it. I have had spicier.  I am from SoCal and that is normal for a lot of the mexican places I eat at. The only thing the sauce did was make my face sweat a little... As far as the burn in my mouth it was no hotter than the fried peppers you can pick up at any authentic mexican restaurant out here. I probably had the equivalent of a teaspoon in less than a half hour. I did not have to drink anything after it. The taste was okay. The only reason why I put it on my food was because it was the only spicy sauce in the house. It is a potent sauce... a little goes a long way but I was sorely disappointed by heat of it... maybe because it was because of all the hype.

Label: Neutral
Content:
First of all, this hot sauce doesn't have any flavor. I thought it would be a bit sour, but no. Its tastes like eating a flaming fart which brings me to the point about smell...

IT KILLS YOUR NOSE.

Thats all I have to say, but one more thing... It burned through the cap and overflowed into the fridge. k bai

Label: Neutral
Content: When I first started to buy VitaGravy, my dogs loved it. After a few weeks, they don't seem to care too much for it anymore. They still get it in their kibble every day, and will eventually eat it when they are hungry, but they don't consider it to be a treat anymore. I still buy it because of its beneficial nutritional value and decent price compared to a pill vitamin supplement. One big negative I have noticed about it is that their face is getting dirty from it. They are white dogs and this product tends to cause increased tear and around-the-mouth stains. I used to buy all different flavors of VitaGravy, buy my groomer told me the chicken flavor is best as the beef and pork based flavors can cause an even worse increase in face staining.

Label: Neutral
Content: having the variety was nice and the kids loved the colors but it wasnt great. the texture was chewy and there is a lot of kernels getting stuck in your teeth compared to others. It was ok tasting tho and always fun to try something new in the hot air popper.

Label: Neutral
Content: Well, bought this for my dad for his birthday since he loves popcorn. These though, no where near as good as I had hoped. Lots of hulls and old maids. Adding butter makes them even less crisp even though they aren't very crisp once popped. Sticks in my teeth too. Sorry, not buying again.

Label: Neutral
Summary: Taste is someone overpowering, has a noticeable after taste.
Content:
I will definitely have to work on tweaking the amount used.
The directions IMO had you using too much, it also left an aftertaste.
In my house we are not regular soda drinkers and have been using more sparking water.
My kids did not like this flavor, I may try mixing it with something else to try and balance the too strong taste.

Label: Neutral
Summary: She must be a picky eater.
Content: My cat barely touches this stuff, especially after the can's been open for about a day or two. This is probably because she was most likely raise on cheap food (we adopted her as an adult) but I can't be sure. Apparently healthy food is less appealing to cats...

Label: Neutral
Content:
I wish every brand would offer a 1 can sample for sale or even free so I can find out if my cat will eat it before
buying 12 cans.

Label: Neutral
Summary: Different Poduct Than What's in the Store.
Content:
We decided to buy this from Petco through Amazon instead of going to their store to get it. It was a little cheaper and it saved us a trip. To our surprise, the product isn't the same color or consistency as what we have purchased from their stores for the last few years. To make matters worse, one of our cats has suddenly developed a swollen lower lip. This can be due to an allergic reaction, and it makes us wonder if it's a response to the obviously different product we received and fed to them.

Update 5-27-10: As noted above, the first two cases were different than what's in the stores. Our next order was normal color and consistency. Looks like a Quality Control issue. I'll update further about our experience.

Label: Neutral
Content:
If my cats could leave reviews they would probably give this product a 1 star. Fortunately they can't, so I'm giving it a 3 stars for effort :) I realize that different cats used to different foods, however mine for some reason would rather starve than eat turkey formula cat food from Wellness. Otherwise I trust Wellness brand, they seem to put good ingredients, and no grains.
Also there was no mentioning anywhere about quantity. It comes in 12 large cans.
Before getting it tho, I suggest you go to local Petco and get a smaller can of same Turkey formula and check if your cats will eat it.

Label: Neutral
Content:
Our three cats don't like this variety. Probably because of the herring.
You would figure thyey would love the fish but I guess has too much of a fish odor.

Label: Neutral
Content:
I love the Wellness Chicken Formula. Great ingredients, solid reputation, and my cats like it (not as much as Weruva, but they don't waste).

Amazon used to ship these is ridiculously oversized boxes with a foot of bubble wrap on every side. It was overkill, but the canned goods arrived without a dent every single time.

Now, on my third shipment in a row, at least one can is dented, and we are talking massively dented to the point where on this 12oz can if you put another on top it won't stand straight because the top is now at an angle. The problem is they use these tiny boxes barely large enough to contain the cat food cans, and the bubble wrap is just these extra large bubbles only placed on two of the four sides, leaving two sides exposed to UPS who inevitably dents most of the cans on those sides.

I don't consider this UPS's fault, as they handle so many packages they can't afford to treat them like raw eggs, its Amazon's fault for repeat inadequate shipping. I am definitely not renewing my prime account.

Label: Neutral
Summary: She eats it but it's like pulling teeth
Content: I was disappointed to have spent the money and then find that my cat does not really like this food.  She will eat it if she's starving and even then I have to sit near and coax her.  She loves Fancy Feast and I only feed her the non-seafood ones and the ones that do not contain wheat gluten (both cause allergic reactions in her) so that narrows her diet down to the FF classic turkey, chicken, and beef.  I hoped to add some variety with this Wellness and hoped to get away from buying cat food with by-products in it but Wellness chicken is not the answer.  It's too thick and sticky.  Too bad for me because it smells WAY better than the Fancy Feast.

Label: Neutral
Content: We've been purchasing direct from retail stores, either PetSmart or Felix & Oscar's in Springfield, VA.  The condition of the cans shipped was not as good as I would have hoped.  Several cans were dented in each shipment.  Quality of the cat food is very good; cost savings may outweigh the shipping issues and the convenience of not going to the pet store.

Label: Neutral
Content: My rating is based on the condition of the product when I recieved it.  Of the case of 12 cans I had ordered, 4 of them had serious dents.  I sent an email about the packaging but received no response.  I would give the product itself at least a 4 rating.

Label: Neutral
Content: My cat loves this food, but this particular flavor, beef and salmon, is a bit strong when it comes to the smell. I had to wash my hands more than once to get the smell entirely off. Now the problem is that my cat reeks of fish, she smells like a walking tuna sandwich. If you're okay with that, by all means get it, but I'm going to avoid this one in the future because I can't stand her smelling like this all the time.

Label: Neutral
Summary: Not to my cat's taste- but adding warm water helped
Content:
I purchased this cat food after reading glowing recommendations from two or three different cat nutrition websites. One site did offer the caveat that while the quality of this brand was excellent it would not help the cat's diet if he refused to eat it and the reviewer's experience was that some cats would love it and others wouldn't touch it. My cat was somewhere in the middle - he didn't love it, but he would sometimes leave it half-eaten and the rest would dry up.

My 8 year old cat is new to canned food - he has been fed a diet of 99.5 percent dry food since we adopted him as a half-grown kitten. (The other .5 percent he obtained himself from ferns and the occasional mouse. After reading an article about the nutritional needs of cats, I discovered that our rotund feline was getting too many carbohydrates and not enough protein, and I began adding canned cat food along side his daily bowl of dry food. I have tried a few different brands to find something that suits him.

The Wellness canned cat food (I purchased the chicken and herring formula)has a pate-texture and I think this was my pet's primary objection to it. After trying several different canned foods, I find that he prefers more of a filet in gravy style preparation.

When I first gave this to my cat I simply plopped the chunk of food into his bowl - leaving it largely in a solid can-shaped blob. Later, I began to add a half-can of warm water to the bowl and mix it up to make a thinner mush. Using this method, he seems to do fine with it, so I may or may not purchase it again.

Label: Neutral
Content: After feeding my recently-acquired cat a case of Wellness Turkey and Salmon without issue, I fully expected her to love the Beef and Salmon as much.  Unfortunately, she loved only the first three cans and won't touch it now without adding some dry food to it.  Hopefully, she will still eat the Turkey and Salmon without any problems.

Label: Neutral
Summary: None of our cats would touch it
Content:
We have been transitioning our 4 cats over from the crap Purina makes to Wellness, and for most of the flavors, they love it. They like it much better than Friskies. Yesterday was the first time we tried the Salmon and Trout flavor, and absolutely none of them would touch it. They left it in their dishes all day and went hungry.

I'll still give it 3 stars, because overall Wellness is better than anything else out there. Just be sure to test out the different flavors on your cats before committing to any bulk orders.

Label: Neutral
Content: A little expensive as a steady staple compared to brown rice or barley. If you're looking for fiber it has twice that per serving of brown rice, but 40% of barley. Interesting texture. Regular rice eaters could find it a taste treat.

Label: Neutral
Content: Melitta has a good taste and if you have no choice but to buy for your Senseo coffee maker, they are ok but you must know in advance they don't fit the senseo very well (too thick) and you have to force closing the top which I felt was the reason i had to replace my coffee maker.

Label: Neutral
Summary: melitta pods for Senseo coffee makers
Content:
There is a problem with the Melitta pods for Senseo coffee makers. The pods are too thick and cause the locking mechanism to pop open during the brewing process, spilling
hot water outside of the nozzle. I have tried this multiple times, with the same result. If you use a used pod, the already compressed pod works alright, but, of course, is not
producing full flavored coffee.

Label: Neutral
Summary: Easy but not for the strong coffee lover
Content: Don't get me wrong. This is a fine product. It came well within it's date code and is a pretty good cup of coffee but I'm just more of a dark roast guy. I'll try another of Melitta's flavors.

Label: Neutral
Content: tastes ok but pods does not fit Senseo coffee maker, I wasted several pods to find a way to use them anyway.

Label: Neutral
Summary: Good flavor, does not fit senseo well
Content:
I like this coffee, but as others have mentioned the pod is a bit thicker than the senseo.

I tried both options:

Put it in the single pod basket on the senseo, force the lock closed. This works well but feels like you will break the machine with time. It really needs forcing.

Or you can put it in the double pod holder. The problem here is it is too loose and does not seal well leaving you with weak coffee. You can moisten the pod before putting it in the machine. This does result in good coffee but is an extra step.

Also they come individually wrapped. Perfect for a hotel or other public use, but a bit of extra waste at home.

I won't buy again, and am looking for another pod that works with Senseo.

Label: Neutral
Summary: This product is dog food not a snack for humans
Content:
I was looking for heathy sweet potato chips and see this item. Ordered it quickly and had to return it because it
is for dogs not for humans.

I have nothing against dogs or dog food. But I think the Amazon website needs to make a clearer distinction
between dog snacks and human snacks and not list them all on the same page for people to choose.

Label: Neutral
Content:
It's a convenient way to get vegetables and it's healthy and vegan. I didn't like the amount of oil in it - too oily. I got tired of a tomato base soup too - but I eventually got through 2 cases. Some cans were dented, but we didn't get sick from them - but dents in food cans causes worry and concern.
I particularly liked the mushrooms in this. It was a little delight each time I got a mushroom in my mouth - just the right texture.
I hope Amy's is working on the BPA issue found in the lining of their (and most everybody else's) cans.

Label: Neutral
Content: for my taste this coffee is quite bitter, although it has no bitter aftertaste..the taste itself is quite ordinary...Lavazza is much better for me..

Label: Neutral
Summary: Good Cookies But I Still Prefer Mallomars and Pinwheels
Content:
I bought a box ( of 12 boxes, I guess that is only shipment that Amazon can send of these cookies ) of these cookies 2 weeks from Amaaon and guess what, NOW THEY"RE ALL GONE! I think I ate 3 boxes of thse cookies and gave the rest away and sold a few. My impression overall of these cookies is that they are very, very well made, the chocolate alone is decandent, the shell is crisp but can be crispier, but they DEFINITELY add TOO MUCH SUGAR IN THESE COOKIES and for that rason I prefer Mallomars to these cookies, which are the closest cookies in comparison to these. Mallomars look like Whippets and but they have a crispier shell, the chocolate is not as good cos it's not so rich and dark, but the cookie base is more solid and the marshmallow is not so sugary. When you eat a Whippet the overall first taste you experience on your palette is a rush of sugar, but with Mallomars you taste the marshmallowy goodness with the sugar.
Pinwheels, a marshmallow cookie that is larger, richer, darker and better overall than both Whippets and Mallomars, have a chocolate coating that is not as good as Whippets but the cookie baase is chocolate, it is more solid and the marshmallow is understated. I don't know if in Montreal, Quebec or wherever in Quebec they love these cookies ( on the package it says they are " Quebec's favorite cookie! ) they LOVE SUGAR but overally my impression is good of these, they defintely did grow on me after I eat maybe two boxes, but I will never buy them again, not one package and definitely not 12, they are just way to sugary for me since my local grocery stores carries PInwheels year round and Mallomars when they're in season there is no need to buy them again. I heartily reccomend that you spend your hard-earned money on Pinwheels rather than these, if you're a sugar-concious American who apprciates a good cookie.

Label: Neutral
Content:
This is the second time I've ordered these cookies. The flavor is very good, and I cannot purchase these locally.
I was a little disappointed because, both times it seems as though the box was stored or shipped in too much heat. All the cookies are stuck together, and the chocolate seemed a little old because it was whitish and grainy.
I still enjoy them, but I just wish they looked like they do in the picture on the box.

Label: Neutral
Content:
The product was shipped by U.P.S. It was clearly marked "Chocolate - Store in a cool dry place." It was, nonetheless, left at my doorstep when I was not home. I do not know how long it had been sitting in the Florida heat before I got home, but the product was melted and all but inedible.

It strikes me that I shuld have received a notice of attempt to deliver, and the product should be kept in a "cool dry place" until it could be accepted by me.

Label: Neutral
Content: The price paid was fair for the quality. I would prefer a finer grind to get more flavor from the grounds. It is a mild roast but has a good flavor. For being organic the price can't be beat.

Label: Neutral
Summary: Great Product but My Dogs Won't Eat It
Content: Great product by Iams but my two mini pinschers would not eat it until they were starving.  I had them on the yellow package puppy Iams and they seemed to like that more.  Don't get me wrong the product is solid with healthy ingredients but my dogs just wouldn't take it.

Label: Neutral
Content: The descripton promises all sorts of flavors.  True, what is there is pretty good.  But I bought this for my daughter's family in May.  Her husband loves licorice.  A sample package they bought in Las Vegas had the licorice flavor included, but in 5 lbs of taffy - there was not a single piece of licorice in this order!  She was very disappointed, and therefore, so was I.  I can understand now why a 2-lb bag of licorice is suggested as a purchase to accompany this.  But 7 lbs???  That's what it would be to buy both.  Well, eventually I did buy the 2 lb bag of licorice, but not from this seller.  Also, this product does not have the Taffy Town tags that the sample from Las Vegas, and also the 2-lb bag I purchased, have on the candy wrappers.  I don't know what that is all about.

Label: Neutral
Content:
The flavor of the taffy was good (not at all "watery" as stated in other reviews). However, the taffy was quite stiff, and did not seem very fresh.
Additionally, this taffy is made with evaporated milk, which was a problem for several people in our family who have milk allergies. I was totally unaware that salt water taffy could/would contain milk.

Label: Neutral
Content: this tea is VERY mild. it came on time and was well packaged, not quite the flavor i wanted but it is a good drink

Label: Neutral
Content: I love the product, they're yummy....however, my baby has choked as well as another friends baby while using these...they tend to break off and don't dissolve too fast. I'm sure when my baby is older they may be ok, but def a choking hazard!!

Label: Neutral
Content: After reading the reviews on these teething biscuits, I was so excited I ordered a case of them. They're still sitting in my cupboard three months later. After a couple tries and near choking incidents, I have decided to wait on giving any more to my son. He is a beginning chewer and could not handle the large pieces. I would recommend using these for older kids ONLY. Had the same negative results with Earth's Best Teething biscuits. The only teething biscuits I recommend for actual teething babies are the Mum Mums. Those melt in the mouth, so no possibility of choking and keep my car relatively crumb free. Win, win.

Label: Neutral
Content: I have been purchasing these for several years. The kids liked them, and continued to like them after they got their teeth, then the adults started eating them, and we've just kept buying them.  But our last order contained 12 boxes of burned, over baked biscuits that no one could eat.  We plan to keep buying, and hopefully that won't happen again.

Label: Neutral
Summary: Good Tea - not sure about weightloss claim
Content: Good Herbal tea - no ceffeine, refreshing taste. However, I cannot vouch for the wieghtloss claim. Maybe because I don't use it to lose weight or maybe because drinking the same quantity of any fluid (water?) before a meal will make you feel "full" anyway .....

Label: Neutral
Content:
not okay for a drip coffee. this fine grind does not work well in my drip machine and 3 out of 4 bricks arrived compressed and one not.
will not buy again but will work for a one time deal.

Label: Neutral
Content: Strong, little bitter, but don't have a rich coffee flavor. You can find the same flavor on supermarket less value, Pilon, Bustelo, etc.

Label: Neutral
Content: I know what other reviewers mean when they say it tasted like Folgers.  It was OK but definitely not e Gusto. It was a good deal for the price. I forgot what I paid but I know it was on sale.

Label: Neutral
Content: After reading all the hype I was lured in to buying this so-called coffee.  Tastes like coffee grind recycled after first use.  The coffee we buy from local super market costs the same but tastes much better.

Label: Neutral
Summary: Not the greatest, but not the worst either.
Content: I drink espresso (moka) daily, and go through a 250g/8.8oz brick in about 2 weeks. In my opinion, this isn't the greatest blend from Lavazza that I've had, but it's not the worst coffee I've had either (it definitely beats the drip coffee I'd otherwise get at work). It's a 70/30 robusta/arabica blend, a dark roast with a fruity though noticeably bitter finish (but not as bad as Starbucks or Peet's coffee). The Lavazza Espresso (black tin, 100% arabica claimed) tastes better than this blend, but after having tried Illy's moka grind, the different blends from Lavazza, Kimbo, Segafredo, and also blends from the local coffee roasters, I actually think that a robusta/arabica blend works best for a moka pot; just not this one. Overall, I'd say that I got what I paid for, but I didn't get what I wanted and I was seduced by the 93 or so 4/5 star reviews for this coffee. I'd really give it a 2.5 or 3 but then again, all taste is subjective, That being said, this is a reasonable coffee (considering taste vs. price), but I'll probably switch back to my regular (and unfortunately more expensive) blend.

Label: Neutral
Content: Lavazza  is best coffee for espresso. Although this blend is good, the Rossa version is better coffee.  The cost is a bit higher, but since you are saving money making your own espresso, spend the extra pennies.

Label: Neutral
Content:
I was buying Lavazza Caffe Espresso at local vons for 5.99. Now it's 7.99 so I checked amazon. still more than 5.99 so I bought this, cheapest Lavazza for 18.98 with subscription.

according to their website, Caffe Espresso is medium, this is dark roast and this has some sweetness.

when i opened the package, soon i noticed this has a stronger aroma, a bitter kind. unlike starbucks italian dark roast, it's still brown.

i used bialetti moka machine. usually make it latte. i think this is bitterer than Caffe Espresso and I feel some bitterness remains on my tongue. maybe this is more like natural Espresso taste but I prefer Caffe Espresso. and i have one opened pack and three unopened packs left...

Label: Neutral
Content: For the longest time I've been looking for something that compares to Illy espresso (medium roast) at a lower price. Thought this was a deal as I've been paying $14+ per can of Illy. I read all the hype & tried to order via Amazon only to be told they will NOT ship this product to Hawaii.I found the Crema e Gusto somewhere else for less than $9/pack; sadly, I was disappointed with the slightly bitter undertone and will most likely go back to Illy. Any Illy addicts out there who found something as good at a lower price?

Label: Neutral
Summary: Not as robust as Cafe Bustelo
Content: From the other reviews I thought this would be at least as full flavored as Cafe Bustelo but it's not. It's more mild and I prefer a deeper stronger coffee flavor. I do like the creamy texture of this coffee but not enough to switch to it. I may try other varieties by Lavazza since it gets such good reviews all the time.

Label: Neutral
Content: The fragrance of this tea is wonderful.  The taste is strong and spicy which I don't care for so at first I tried adding honey.  The honey made it taste disgusting.  So the next night I added 1% low fat milk which made the taste more tolerable.  It also seems to make me drowsy so I drink it near bed time.

Label: Neutral
Content: mom and i both liked this tea at changs.  it seems a bit watered down at home and i have even doubled up.  the flavor is nice, sweet and flowery but it is weak.  all in all we still like it.

Label: Neutral
Content: I ordered these late on a Thursday and they arrived on Monday afternoon.  I thought that was great processing/shipping considering they came from California, and I live in South Carolina.  All lollipops were packaged well and none were broken.  Taste was average.  Not really cherry (like in description), just sweet.  One disappointing note... the wrapper on the lollipop clearly says "Oriental Trading Company" and "Made in China."  It wasn't really fitting with the image of freshness I had from looking at their store description.

Label: Neutral
Summary: Not The Same as the Nestle product
Content: The Wonka product I received is not the same texture, taste, pleasure of the Nestle version this. I wont buy this any more.  Breaks down too fast in your mouth.  Too sweet as well.

Label: Neutral
Content: Would not order this again.  Buying at a local store would have been better.  Seemed dry and not as fresh as I hoped.

Label: Neutral
Content:
This stuff can travel to your house by USPS or UPS truck because it uses chemical preservatives.

Otherwise, nice taste, especially good when toasted or at least microwave re-heated. Best use: Sandwich wraps.

Label: Neutral
Content: Just note when ordering you will receive 48 bottles. Not in the display box, but 48 separate bottles with some bubble wrap on top.

Label: Neutral
Content: I love this gum. 5 star love it. I am doing this to replace the only current negative review, which is just ridiculous.

Label: Neutral
Summary: Taste like soy sauce, but with less salt.
Content: It took some getting used to, but I am satisfied with the taste. I recommend to anyone on a salt restricted diet.

Label: Neutral
Content:
it was cheap, it was delivered fast & in good condition, but the "hot" variety is seriously lacking in flavor compared to the regular variety.
though tasty & satisfying, next time i'll stick with the original!

Label: Neutral
Summary: Less spicier than the real Korean version
Content:
I guess NongShim made this as export version as they do with many many other noodle products.
Usually they are much less spicy.
And this is the same.
When I opened this bag, it was yellow, not red at all.
Original Korean version of this snack is much more red in color and has very nice spicy taste.
But this barely has any spicy to it if not at all.
Well, I couldn't taste any spicy at all, seriously AT ALL.
If you have Korean supermarket nearby, go buy one from there and compare yourself.
My non-Korean husband agrees with me one this so...

Label: Neutral
Summary: Not too shrimpy, not too hot.
Content: Odd texture too.  I prefer the shrimp chips that are more like pork rinds.  These are more like cripy french fries.

Label: Neutral
Content: Although they don't really have much of a seafood flavor, let alone shrimp, they are a bit spicy and nice to snack on asw an alternative to other std. similar snacks.

Label: Neutral
Summary: Easier online, no deal on price
Content: I purchased this product online because I couldn't find it in the stores at that time (2 days later it was in the store also). It's good that comes quick, save a trip to the store, however, no deal on the price; same as Walmart, Kroger, etc.

Label: Neutral
Summary: 50c per box more expensive than stores
Content: I purchased this product online because I couldn't find it in the stores at that time (2 days later it was in the store also). It's good that comes quick, save a trip to the store, however, the price is so much higher than Walmart, Kroger, etc (50c per box more expensive, total 7$ more expensive than the stores)

Label: Neutral
Content: the only reason I purchased this on amazon is because I could not find it in the stores and the pediatrician had recommended it for my infant grandson.  It does not disolve well and tends to clump up in the nipple.

Label: Neutral
Content: Its a good robust coffee, however not much different from any other brand as coffees go. Not sure it is worth the energy of ordering, shipping cost (if you have to pay it). I am at the store at least 4 times a week so picking up coffee I like is not a problem.

Label: Neutral
Content: My baby loves these.  However, the packaging is over the top.  Do the rusks really need to be individually wrapped, as well as, wrapped in another plastic bag, inside of a cardboard box?

Label: Neutral
Content:
We've only tried the vegetable version but my 6 month old loves it. It dissolves right when you bite it, and she enjoys holding it and putting it in her mouth. I only gave it 3 stars because it is no different from the rice crackers they sell at the Asian groceries. I thought I was getting a good deal on Amazon, but the ones at the Asian groceries are only 2-3 bucks a package. I agree with a previous poster that this company uses an awful lot of packaging. It's a nuisance especially since there is so much eco-awareness nowadays.

BTW, my two year old loves these too so I always have them handy in the trunk of the car. These will get crushed in your diaper bag, so stash somewhere safe :)

Label: Neutral
Summary: MIC is fine, but THE NUTRITION FACTS are not
Content:
Some people are concerned about this product being made in China, personally I think it's fine, since it's from the largest rice cracker manufacturer in the world, they should have decent quality control systems-- after all, the ingredients from the frightening food scandals in China never appears in any of their product that's made in China. (Interestingly, some of their adult rice snacks made in Taiwan were involved).

However, I hope I've read the nutrition facts before purchasing this product:it has sugar and sodium. Baby food are not supposed to have sugar and salt added into it. THEY ARE FOR ADULTS! Especially, the sodium per serving for this product is about 2/3 the value for reduce fat potato chips. Since you cannot return grocery purchases on Amazon, think twice before you buy this. My daughter is 8 months old, I'll probably give her this after she's 12 months old -- since I cannot return this anyway, but I won't give her too much in a day simply because of they added salt into this product.

Label: Neutral
Content: My 12 month old has just been diagnosed with a wheat/egg/nut allergy, so I have been hunting for snacks that she can tolerate. I was pretty excited to find these and I purchased the 6 pack. She does like them a lot, but I have to say that I was surprised to see that the rice husks are made in China. Had I known that fact, I would have never bought them. I wish Amazon would have listed that under product description.

Label: Neutral
Content: Baby Mum Mum makes a sticky mess.  I suppose no more or less then other teething crackers.  I do like that the grams of sugar is minimal compared to other teething biscuits.  I started giving our 8 month old wheat, unsalted pretzels which is the perfect shape and size for his little fingers.  The pretzels also create less of a mess.  I give the Baby Mum Mums right before planned bath time.

Label: Neutral
Content: Nothing makes these chicken breasts special whatsoever. They are standard generic tasting chicken breasts, tiny ones at that. They are tender and juicy when grilled, I will say that...but you'll be through eating one in less than 2 minutes. There's no difference between Omahas chicken breasts and regular chicken breasts I can buy in any grocery store Save a lot/Aldi included....for well over 1/2 the price of what they charge for these and for nearly quadruple the amount. So, why charge so much for these? I can get behind their steaks, even though they're overpriced too, and a few other Omaha products like the hot dogs and stuffed baked potatoes, but can't really get behind these chicken breasts. It's not like these are organic chicken breasts that have a decent size to them, which is what the price Omaha charges for them would suggest. These are as generic as generic gets. Would of been fine if 1 of their chicken breasts was the size of 2 of their chicken breasts. Instead it's like they got 1 large chicken breast and cut it it up to make 4 out of it. Luckily, I received these in a comped sampler. There's no reason whatsoever for anyone to buy just these chicken breasts through Omaha Steaks as Omaha gives you no reason to. Omaha really needs to make their portions bigger. People would be fine paying their prices if the portions were bigger...but half the things they sell the price to size ratio leaves you feeling ripped off. Not that I paid for these as like I said they were comped, but if I did no doubt I'd feel pretty ripped off. Change your mentality Omaha. Instead of less is more, think MORE is MORE. Get with the times.

Label: Neutral
Content: I had high hopes when I started my 1 y/o golden on this food.  I believe in the quality of the ingredients and the brand itself is easily available at our local petsmart store.  Unfortunately, even after switching brands gradually, our dog continues to have abnormally soft stools.  He did seem to love the taste...  but I am currently feeding him homemade ground turkey/ rice combo. and will gradually get him started on a different blue buffalo type (the large breed version).  We'll see how that one works out... it doesn't have quite as much protein and we're hopeful that his system will handle it better.  Update:  Out dog did great after we switched him to the large breed Blue formula.  He is currently on the weight control version and loving it... no more problems.  Very pleased with the brand overall!

Label: Neutral
Content: I like bold coffee. This is a little bolder than I like. But for those who like it strong, they will enjoy this.

Label: Neutral
Content: I don't know, people seem to like this k-cup, but it just did not do it for me.  Maybe I got a bad batch, as it was simply overpowering for me.  And I do like many of the bolder k-cups, such as Midnight Magic and Rainforest Espresso, but those are simply better coffees to me.  Maybe I'll give the Emeril's regular another chance, but it did not win me over the first time around.  As a side-note, I really like the Emeril's decaf--it is much more drinkable to me than the Emeril's regular.

Label: Neutral
Content: I love good strong coffee. It's a combination on how it's roasted and the beans used. This coffee is just way too strong. It is unbalanced and though isn't bitter (which comes from weaker coffee) it is a tad over roasted and charred tasting. Instead of tasting toasty nuances you are stuck with a smack in the face. Though very good for that wake up coffee, it's not the coffee to have if you want to savor the rich and delicate nuances that many good coffees bring to the table.

Label: Neutral
Summary: Nice bold K-Cup but left a weird after taste
Content:
This is a good choice for a K-Cup if you like a bold rich cup of coffee. I ordered this brand for 3-4 months because it was the best tasting bold K-Cup I found.

I am giving it three stars because the last few shipments were not that great. It left both me and my husband with a weird metallic taste after one cup.

I ordered Martinson's bold K-Cups about a month ago and loved it! I probably will not buy this brand again.

Label: Neutral
Summary: Pretty good if you don't get one with a defective seal
Content:
This coffee actually tastes pretty good for a darker roast however the number of defective K-cups with seal problems can be significant. The issue is that the seal covering the Kcup, which gets punctured to enable the drip through, seems to continually burst open during brewing, resulting in coffee grounds in your mug and quite a mess of the machine. My wife and I have started calling these "bursters" as it happens quite frequently with these Emeril's Kcups. You can clearly hear it from far away when you get a burster and I think if you were to be doing something directly over the machine (such as putting dishes away in a cabinet above it) there is a possibility of getting in contact with some of the scalding hot steam from the sudden release of the pressure when the seal breaks open. The seal bursts right at the final peak brewing time, probably at about the last 30% of the brewing process. The result are a lot of coffee grounds in your mug and over the machine brewing area.

I have been buying a lot of Kcups quite frequently in bulk that past few months. I've tried many different types of Kcups and have purchased several hundred of each, I have never had this happen to any except the Emeril ones. This is not just an isolated incident, there a significant number of defective ones in each of the 18 count boxes. Usually if you get a box which has a burster you are going to get quite a few in there, probably around 5 at least.

Wherever these specific Kcups are being made, there is a clearly a problem in the manufacturing processing and quality controls checks. I've also seen a few cases where I have gotten a Kcup that has 2 seals pressed onto it thus resulting in a broken seal right out of the box.

The coffee actually tastes pretty good, I really like darker roasts and this is one of my favorite ones however the quality control needs to be significantly improved. If I was paying full retail for these I would be pretty annoyed, I think I've paid full retail for these once at a premium supermarket and sure enough there were a couple bursters in that box so it is not an issue with the bulk purchases or anything like that. As I said I've bought hundreds of other brands in bulk and have had no issues yet.

Label: Neutral
Content: I am a fan of strong black coffee, but this product tastes almost over roasted to me. Of all the K cups I have tried, this would probably be my least favorite.

Label: Neutral
Content: The coffee itself is awesome.  Good, strong taste.  It is the only kind I order.  However, I counted the k-cups this time since the box you see is all they come in.  They are dumped in there.  I decided to count them this time and I only received 45 k-cups not 50.  I called Amazon and they refunded me 10% which is what the 5 cups were worth.  I feel they should have done a little more for the trouble, but I won't make a deal out of that.  Just make sure you count them when you open the box.

Label: Neutral
Summary: This is good, but it's far from the best.
Content:
Don't mean to be the one who rains on the bandwagon (pardon the metaphor crash), but, while it is definitely true what other reviewers have written -- that the coffee is very strong, very thick, and very dark (add in an acid level commensurate with the sludge-factor) -- I don't find the taste all that strong, and taste is important.

True, these K-Cups will provide a pleasant-tasting beverage the consistency and color of Louisiana mud, but for taste, one can do a lot better.

Just for kicks, I had K-cups of coffee back-to-back today, one of this type and one of Keurig K-Cup "Mini-Brewers" Newman's Own Organics Extra Bold, which is, unfortunately, sold out at the moment. True, Newman's (RIP) is hardly as dark a roast or as thick a beverage, but the flavor punches through very robustly and is totally superior in the area that counts the most to me -- taste. It's a lot "Bold"er than this brand.

One of my favorite dark roasts is the Coffee People line, even of decafs, which truly bury the "Big Easy Bold" in the taste department, too, even if one drinks the decaf. Diedrich coffees come to mind as well as clear winners.

Maybe I'm spoiled, but I tend to use fewer of the ready-mixed K-Cups brand coffees than employing the Keurig My K-Cup Reusable Coffee Filter and selecting my own brand and grind. My current favorite brand of coffee comes from a pair of small roasting houses in Washington state and Alaska. I keep a couple days' worth ground and ready to put into the Keurig My K-Cup Reusable Coffee Filters, and there are few pre-packed ground K-Cups that can come anywhere close to the richness of the flavors and choices available if one "rolls one's own."

I've got nothing against Emeril's, and it's a far superior cup of coffee to anything you'll get in most restaurants. But, happily, we can best that effort without trying too hard.

Label: Neutral
Summary: I think I reviewed these in the past...
Content:
We bought a box. They kept exploding in the Keurig Machine. We received a second box and they worked better. We just bought another box and now every 5th one or so explodes in the machine. The malfunction ranges from dripping coffee and granules spilling over the sides of the cartridge holder to spraying hot water everywhere.

The coffee tastes good though.

Label: Neutral
Content: If you like your coffee strong, you will like this.  There is a slightly bitter taste typical with most bold coffee (I guess).  I prefer a medium blend, however I can brew two cups from one kcup and get a cup to my liking.  So you might consider brewing two cups from one kcup and cut your cost in half.

Label: Neutral
Content: I like a good strong cup of joe.  This is just a strong cup of average joe.  It is no Community coffee, no 8 o'clock coffee with the spoon standing straight up.  It is better than many other standard k cups.  But still I think there are better full bodied k cups out there.

Label: Neutral
Content:
I can purchase an 18 pack of these at Target for $11.99 (that's $0.61/cup) instead of the much-too-high $0.85 per cup price here. Beware Amazon Prime members....K cups aren't a good deal on Amazon, despite the free two day shipping.
The coffee itself is GREAT. I basically like a cup of mud, as bold as it gets. This is that, with a great burnt taste and wonderful aroma.
HIGHLY recommend the coffee, but get it at Target.

Label: Neutral
Content: I didn't care for this blend because for a extra bold, it had a weak taste.  Its hard to explain but a bold and extra bold has a dark, rich taste to it, and this blend was disappointing.  I was just missing that bold flavor.  It tasted like McDonald's coffee that has been sitting for an hour.  The smell was also weak.

Label: Neutral
Summary: It's OK, There are a lot of bold k-cup options. This one is just OK.
Content:
We have tried a lot of bold K cups and this one had a flat aftertaste. It did not have that flavor that sticks with you. We prefer Newmans Own Extra bold as our fav Bold offering. But we do have some family members who prefer this one so we get a box about once a year.

Vanilla Bean Bam is the best Emeril that we have had. It is very good!

Label: Neutral
Content: This is a bold cup of coffee, but if you prefer a bold cup with a little more of a fun taste, go over to Coffee People or Newmans Bold or we even really like Santa's Buzz....just better ones out there....

Label: Neutral
Content: We just recently got our Keurig brewer and have been expeerimenting with different coffees.  My husband wanted to try something a little stronger, so I ordered the Emeril's Big Easy Bold.  It was a little too bold for his taste, but he said it was a good-tasting coffee.  For those who like a stronger tasting coffee, it is probably a good one.

Label: Neutral
Content: If you like really strong coffee this is for you!!! Emeril definitely takes it up a notch!

Label: Neutral
Content: I make two (2) cups with one "K-Cup" it is indeed a robust coffee, not burnt tasting like dark roast, just strong.

Label: Neutral
Content: Interestingly, I do not disagree with the positive reviews -- this is a super strong coffee! Army coffee, as one reviewer said! Or, a slap in the face, as another one said! This is just too strong for me. I thought I liked strong coffee until I tasted this one. It made me realize I'm really a medium type of girl. I drink my coffee black and I had to water this one down to be able to drink it at all. I would have given only one star, b/c I don't like it personally, but gave it three b/c I recognize that what I hate about it is exactly what some will love about it! So, army coffee lovers, slap-in-the-face coffee lovers, this is for you! Medium guys and gals, not so much.

Label: Neutral
Content:
I have to agree with Dr. Pete's review below. Up until this batch, Emeril's Big Easy was by far my favorite coffee. To give you an idea of what my taste runs to, I also drink Gloria Jean's Black Gold, Coffee People Black Tiger, and Tully's Italian Roast along with an occasional Van Houtte's Honduran. However, Emeril's was my standard cup. But this latest bunch is nearly tasteless and watery! It used to have a great aroma, full body, and was easily drinkable. The only reason I didn't score it lower was because it is still not bitter or has a bad after taste.

I am not sure what to do now. I just put this on auto renew when I got this batch. I'm kinda' scared to keep on getting it, if it is going to stay this way. I might just cancel it and drink more Black Tiger (the most similar IMHO). Too bad; I have frequently seen coffee quality from the same brand change in my life- and not only in the k-cups.

Update: I tried using this on my 7.5oz instead of 9.5oz setting, and it is somewhat better. However, it is still not nearly as flavorful as it usually was on 9.5oz. I am really puzzled why more people have not experienced this; maybe my taste buds are growing Old? ;o) However, my other coffees still taste the same.

Label: Neutral
Content:
This was my first time trying this brew of Kcup. It is ok, but the flavor is a bit acidic. I like a bold brew, even though I do add cream and Equal. When using this Kcup, I found I used at least one extra sweetener packet and twice the half & half. Friends of mine have enjoyed this flavor, however.

I'd like to find a brand of kcup that is similar to Newman's Own, extra bold. I have found this brand on Amazon, but it is through outside sellers, so not eligible for subscribe & save. The price through these vendors is also nearly twice the price of most of the kcups offered on amazon. So, for now, I will keep trying different varieties of kcups and trudge to Walmart to buy boxes of Newman's Own Bold 18 kcups for $10. If I see them on Amazon, I'll probably order several boxes.

Label: Neutral
Content: It made me realize I do have limits with caffeine. I drink my coffee black and I had to water this one down to be able to drink it at all. I would have given only one star, b/c I don't like it personally, but gave it three b/c I recognize that what I hate about it is exactly what some will love about it! So, all the coffee lovers, , this is for you! Medium guys and gals, not so much. Interestingly, I do not disagree with the positive reviews -- this is a really strong coffee! Emirils coffee, as one reviewer said! Or, a slap in the face, as another one said! This is just too strong for me. I thought I liked strong coffee until I tasted this one.

Label: Neutral
Summary: Love the coffee but not the new higher Amazon prices
Content:
Love this coffee. However, now that Amazon has substantially raised, by 25-30% the prices across the board and subscribe and save has been removed I have found, at least temporarily, a cheaper place to buy. If you have a Bed Bath and Beyond near and get the 20% off coupons you can buy three 18 box cartons and save about $5. Cost me with tax about $25 and I got 6 extra cups vs the 48 box offered here. Just a suggestion. There may be other places as well.

I do enjoy buying from Amazon and hope, maybe after the holidays? that the prices will become competitive again.

Label: Neutral
Summary: Decent noodles if you can find them at a much better price. I can find gourmet noodles in this cost range.
Content: These noodles are a decent find, but don't overpay for them. Currently priced at 17 USD / 12pk, with the ramen at 15 USD / 12pk, I can get the same product in the same exact format in the price range of 2-4 USD, even at WalMart, where prices are not that competitive. The same goes for all the maruchan instant soups and noodles on this site currently. Wait until the price becomes reasonable, then stock up, otherwise buy elsewhere. Don't be insane and pay what I can get a decent dinner for, for a small package of instant noodles.

Label: Neutral
Summary: Not as good as I expected
Content:
This product was very salty for me and my family. After eating, we had to drink a lot of water.. Did not taste any Pesto since salt overtook the whole Mezzaluna.

If you buy this product, you may want to think how you can make this salty taste less stands out.
It takes 15 min. to cook. I am going back to Barilla Tortellini.

Label: Neutral
Content:
Upon ordering this tea I thought it would be a strong and dark earl grey. Instead I received a tea that is very bland and in order to improve on the flavor I have to double up on my bags.

This tea is about half as strong as Bigelow's earl grey blend.

Label: Neutral
Content: We love getting this by the case since we drink so much of it.  However, the last case showed up and about 90% of all the bags were not "stuffed" and folded closed properly.  Resulting in massive amounts of tea spilling out.  Not the end of the world.  you could just stuff the bag into a tea ball and that would get you by.  We resorted to shaking all the tea to the side of the bag that was folded closed properly and rolling up the edge and winding the string around it to keep it that way while steeping.  Again, not the end of the world but an annoyance.  If the next case shows up like this I think we'll send it back.  But I don't know who to request to make good on it; Amazon or Twinings

Label: Neutral
Content:
If you are on a tight budget, as I am, then I think this Earl Grey is fine. For the same price, I prefer Bigelow. For Pete's sake, stay away from Lipton's black tea. (I can't speak as to their green tea.) I used to drink Lipton tea as we get the bags free at work. Once I tried Twinings and then Bigelow, there was no going back. The Lipton teas are bitter tasting in comparison.

If you are able to splurge once in a while, try Mountain Rose Herbs brand of Earl Grey. The difference will blow you away. The bergamot really stands out in this tea, I mean REALLY. I haven't seen it offered online here at Amazon. I had to order it directly from Mountain Rose and it was $11 for one pound plus shipping. The tea is organic, kosher and fair trade certified! Their website is here:[...]

So, if you like Twinings, try Bigelow, which is the same price, but a tad better. If you are able to splurge, try Mountain Rose...but be warned, it will spoil you for other teas forever.

Label: Neutral
Content:
The soups that I ordered were delicious. Let me begin with that. However, it took me awhile to receive them. The first order I received was only an empty box. Apparently it was damaged during shipping and was torn open. I emailed Amazon and they replaced the shipment immediately with no questions asked. THANK YOU.

The second (same) shipment that I received was also damaged. This time, the outside of the packaging was fine, but the soups were leaking. Of the 32 total soup packets, 8 of them work broken open.

The failing, I believe, is not in the shipping but rather the packaging of these. They need to be shipped in a tight box rather than the large box they were delivered.

I operate a small shop inside an office building, and really would like to continue ordering these soups, however, they are too expensive to lose 25% upon delivery.

Thanks, I look forward to improvements...at least in shipping.

Regards,
John Jean
[...].

Label: Neutral
Summary: No Sugar is a Lie!  Taste sooo good though.
Content: I was trying to buy a more healthier type of frappe, as I love cold coffee drinks.  I was stationed in Iraq, but hot coffee just didn't do it for me...especially in 121 degree weather.  Well, the front label says "NO SUGAR"; however, the ingredients include sugar and corn syrup.  Well, it's simply delish, but it HAS SUGAR! I'd still buy it again though.  Actually, I bought all five flavors.  Just disappointed that the label is misleading.

Label: Neutral
Content:
I got my order very quickly. Thank you.
I thought the bars were bigger, as I have gotten them before, so a little more expensive compared to Costco, 1.7 oz bars, but I love them
Rita Power

Label: Neutral
Content:
When they arrive and are fresh, you can't beat them. When they arrive and are obviously old and out of date, you want to beat them just to avoid cracking a tooth. I am thinking about getting away from this product due to inconsistency with Amazon delivery and freshness.

I would say: Buyer Beware

Label: Neutral
Content: The Trio Bars taste great,  however I will not purchase them again, the label clearly states product of China.  Too many issues with edible products made in China.

Label: Neutral
Content:
My family drinks a lot of coconut milk (about a can a day) and we have tried almost every brand out there. This one tastes OK, but contains more preservatives than any other we have tried. Unfortunately the ingredients are not listed here so I wasn't able to find that out until after my case arrived.

For the price this Roland brand isn't a bad deal but I would recommend Chaokoh or Natural Value Coconut Milk, 14-Ounce Containers (Pack of 12) over this one. Natural Value has no fillers or preservatives and tastes great which means it is perfect for making healthy coconut yogurt with the Salton YM9 1-Quart Yogurt Maker. If you haven't tried making coconut yogurt yet I highly recommend it!

A lot of people are still under the impression that Coconut milk is bad for you. There was some faulty research done years ago on hydrogenated coconut oil which is mostly to blame for this. If you are one of those people that still think coconut is bad I recommend reading The Good Fat Cookbook to help set the record straight.

Label: Neutral
Summary: Good Price, Great Taste, Too many Ingredients
Content: I ordered this thinking it was just coconut milk, but there are a few other ingredients in there as well. Next time I will pay more for the organic version, which reviewers have said has less added "stuff." But for the price you get a great tasting coconut milk that makes delicious ice cream. If you don't mind the extra "stuff" this is 5 stars.

Label: Neutral
Content: Product description is not complete and clear. I ordered the wrong product. However, Amazon customer service is excellent and I got my refund after a phone call.

Label: Neutral
Content: It's the same Chef Boyardee that I've loved since I was a kid, but about a third of the cans were dented.  Of those four were so badly dented that I was too cautious to eat them.  Sort of negates the savings from buying in bulk when I have to throw four cans away.  I may try this again hoping I just got a bad bunch.
