The drawback is that my other two cats prefer this food to their original brand, so it's quite expensive for three cats. The other two have not gained weight with this product, and their appetite does not appear to have increased at all.

Label: Neutral
Content: I bought this for my cat, who suddenly started vomiting on a daily basis. No rhyme or reason for it either, not hairballs, or some kind of illness. This didn't help the vomiting issue and considering the cost of the food and composition, I've since switched her to a product richer in proteins that costs a similar amount and actually seems to have quickly cleared up the problem.

Label: Neutral
Summary: Way more expensive per pound than the larger-sized bags of the same food
Content: I posted my review for the quality of this cat food here: Hill's Science Diet Adult Sensitive Stomach Dry Cat Food - 15.5-Pound Bag, which is the same food as this but in a larger bag. Here, I just wanted to point out that this smaller size bag is actually much more expensive. As of the date I'm writing this, this 3.5-pound bag costs $3.71 per pound, whereas the 7-pound bag costs $3.50 per pound and the 15.5-pound bag costs $2.32 per pound. So you pay over 50% more per pound for this size compared with the largest size. Just wanted to point this out in case it could save anyone money! I like the cat food a lot.

Label: Neutral
Content: This food may be good for my cats, but two of my ragdolls, and these are large cats, will not eat the chunks because they are so large.

Label: Neutral
Content:
I fed this product to my cat and my roommate's cat. I was experimenting with food since the cats are almost 1, and I wanted to introduce different kinds of adult food so they'd get used to them. I mixed half Science Diet dry kitten food with this product, and the cats began to eat less. I was worried about how much they were eating (nearly 1/4 their original diet) so I filled one bowl with this indoor cat food and one bowl with their kitten food. They barely touched the indoor cat food, while eating most of their kitten food. I ended up having to mix some canned cat food in with it to get them to eat.

Part of it might be that the food is triangular and much larger than the kitten food. They had a hard time eating it at first, since they were used to the small pieces of the kitten food.

Don't be discouraged, though. My cat can't tell the difference between the kitten food and the regular adult food. They really enjoy Science Diet's fish flavored food, so give that a try.

Label: Neutral
Summary: Item shipped smaller than what is pictured
Content:
These are genuine Kasugai wasabi peas which are quite good, but the packages they shipped me are 3.06 oz instead of the 4.23 oz package pictured (or the 4 oz. shipping weight mentioned in the description).

Keep this in mind if you are trying to shop on price.

Label: Neutral
Content:
I had never seen or heard of this cheese before when I saw it in the cheese section of my local supermarket, so I bought one out of curiosity. It's almost uncanny how caramel-like it is. It looks like an oversized version of a caramel candy you get at a store. It's brown-ish in color (like caramel). It's not a very hard cheese or very soft. It slices very easily. The taste is sweetly reminiscent of caramel. Maybe it would pair well with chocolate.

It's so much like caramel that it is very unlike any other cheese I've tasted. That's the reason I only give it three stars - maybe it's technically a cheese, but it doesn't taste like cheese. That said, it's not bad, it's just unexpected.

Label: Neutral
Content: Beacuase of its crunchiness, you can't get enough. Unfortuneately its made from horseradish and food coloring. True wasabi almost tatses like spicy pungent mint. I still like the crunch it packs and enjoy my sinuses being drained out.

Label: Neutral
Content:
Okay, first, I love GoPicnic stuff in general. This was my first GoPicnic item, and I really enjoyed having it on whatever plane flight I brought it for. The crackers and hummus are absolutely *delicious*, and I practically licked the hummus tube clean. I could've eaten a half-dozen servings of those chips & hummus, in fact.

But there's a few downsides, and they really got in the way of my love for this particular gopicnic.

First, the hummus tube sometimes opens easily -- but sometimes it's like trying to open an over-glued box of milk when you're a little kid. You keep making dents, but you can't get at what you're after. Or, if you do, you end up somehow making holes in multiple spots and it oozes out of each. The tube could really use some kind of redesign. Both to make it easier to open, *and* to make it easier to get everything out once you *do* pry it open. I'm sure if you're eating it at lunch at your desk you've got scissors and can make short work of the task, but flying in coach you face a far more daunting task.

Then, my second beef: The nut/fruit mix. This is, obviously, just a personal taste issue. I'm sure someone, somewhere, likes the mix. Me, I'd rather eat fruitcake. Or collard greens. (As you can probably guess, I don't care for either of those, either.) If I open the fruit/nut mix at all, it's to pick through and find a few bits I like. But that's a waste, and usually a bit disappointing. The desert, a dark chocolate square, is great for you pious lovers of the mystical chocolate -- but, me, I'm a wuss and like my chocolate like I like my women. Milky? Okay, that makes no sense. But I definitely prefer a lighter, milkier chocolate. Oh, and I almost forgot the dried edamame -- another dud for me. Which is weird, because I adore fresh edamame.

Do I eat the dried edamame? Or the chocolate square? Or the fruit/nut mix? Yeah, usually I'd eat at least some of it, feeling kind of silly for just eating crackers and hummus when I paid for the whole box. I often peer around at whoever I'm traveling with, hoping/wishing I can get one of them to give the food a whirl so I don't feel like such an uncouth waster of perfectly good food.

I'm trying not to vote this too low due to the food choices, because that's a personal taste thing, and I'm sure the components are well-executed. My low score is for the logistical difficulty involved. The best part of the whole meal is the hummus, but I can't *get* to it. And even when I do get to it, I can seldom get it all -- in both cases, this makes me a sad monkey. I hope my three stars aren't unfair. And I hope someday GoPicnic can tweak the packaging, or the lineup, or *something*. I really like the way they do things, so I'd *love* to love this. I just can't, not right now.

Label: Neutral
Content:
While I like the meals in general, this one had a nasty surprise. The package of edamame is PRODUCT OF CHINA.

Knowing China's food safety standards or total lack thereof, who would want to put that in their mouth? Bad show. Pick another supplier, GoPicnic!

Label: Neutral
Content: There are so many hummus flavors out there that upon trying this and finding it bland with a sour aftertaste I was disappointed.  The crackers are the same multi-grain in several other gopicnics and are good but the roasted endamame...um...bland.  Dray and bland and sawdusty even.  Maybe if the main meal (hummus) had been flavorful these would have been a good side. No.  There are many flavors of endamame also on the market, why combine bland hummus with bland endamame??  I felt like I was eating a cardboard box.  The nut mix is good...it's also in the turkey sticks meal but the dark chocolate was a disappointment.  Mostly because it wasn't a more exciting dessert to reward you after eating a cardboard box for a meal.  Not even remotely interested in repurchasing.

Label: Neutral
Summary: wish there was more of that nut mixture...
Content: i bought this to have a handy gluten free snack - LOVED the nut/fruit mixture - wish i could buy it in bulk, i love crunchmaster crackers.. the hummus was ok  tasting, chocolate fine . i really didn't like the edamame .. it had a funny aftertaste .. i would buy again to have on hand - would prefer twice the amt of fruit/ nut mixture and no edamame! ..

Label: Neutral
Summary: Dark Chocolate spoiled in all 6 packages.
Content: Dark chocolate spoiled in all 6 packages.  Everything else was great. Also, had the same spoiled chocolate dessert in the Salami and cheese product.

Label: Neutral
Content:
I'm a GF/CF mom, and I was looking for something: #1 to bring with me when I to go work, #2 to send with my daughter for lunches, and #3 to bring for the family when we go on a "field trip" like to the museum or the pool.

#1: GREAT choice! I LOVE the hummus, crackers, and fruit/nuts. The soybeans are ok. I give the chocolate to my husband or a friend. (I'm trying to avoid sugar.) I like that the meal is high in protein (25g!!) and fiber (12g!!). The individual packages make it easy to adjust to the size of my hunger: have one thing now; eat another later. Also, it's great to have a quick GF/CF option for times when I know I won't have a fridge or a stove.

#2: Bad choice! These are not for children--even an adventurous one like mine! For example, the fruit and nut mix is called "Baja Blend", and it contains "Habanero Almonds" and . Few children will be able to handle this level of spiciness. My daughter LOVE edamame so I thought she'd go for them roasted, but these are very strong. Even the chocolate is a very bitter, dark chocolate. It's just not kid-food.

#3 Ok choice. Divided amongst our family we can easily find someone to take each item from this box, and the fact that each item is individually wrapped makes it nice for the snack-style eating we do on a field trip, but they're really just too expensive to be used in this way. We're better off just packing the items that we want.

Label: Neutral
Content: This was a good idea. Unfortunately, the main ingredient, the hummus - is what put it in the fail category for me. Aside from the chocolate, which seemed old to me, the other components were tasty enough. The hummus was not right as far as I was concerned. It came in a tube kind of like toothpaste and even if you could get past that, the taste was not like any hummus I have ever enjoyed. I realized that it was risky, as it is hard to beat delicious fresh hummus, but I was just hoping.

Label: Neutral
Summary: A good portable gluten free lunch option
Content: Overall, this product is a great idea. Portable, doesn't need to be refrigerated, low calorie, gluten free. However...this is the worst tasting hummus I have ever had in my entire life. The chocolate was crushed and resembled taffy. The trail mix is good, as are the crackers, especially considering they're gluten free. I purchased this six pack for around $18. At the current price ($29), I don't think I would purchase these at around $5 a piece - just get together some gluten free snacks and put them together in your own lunch kit.

Label: Neutral
Summary: Good tasting, but not a good value.
Content:
Let me be clear, I thought the GoPicnic meals tasted good and were incredibly filling for the small amount of food in the kit. This is not to mention that the food provided is relatively healthy.

My complaint comes in with the sheer cost of these meals. At around $4.16 per meal, this only becomes a good value only to those eating either very high-end foods or going out to eat for lunch every day. If you already take your lunch to school or work, chances are that your existing lunch is cheaper than it would be through GoPicnic.

While Amazon gives a 15% discount and a $1.00 coupon, this still doesn't make it too much better. You're almost certainly better off buying hummus and crackers in bulk and portioning it out into lunches than by going this route. If you'd rather have convenience and don't mind paying a premium for it, then GoPicnic may be for you.

Label: Neutral
Summary: Not strong at all, do not use by itself
Content: The seasoning is terrible. You can doctor it however, but do not, I repeat, do not use it by itself. It seriously tastes like dried grass. I'm sure if you use it in a vinaigrette, or some other concoction it'd add a nice element. Alone, is tastes like crap.

Label: Neutral
Content:
The label contains an allergen statement that this product was processed on equipment that also processes peanuts, tree nuts, soy, milk, eggs and wheat.

It would be very nice if the product description here would include this sort of very important information.

This is the second Taste Specialty spice/herbal product that I've purchased has this same warning. The first was crystalized ginger, which would have been processed in a whole different manner, and presumably on different equipment. The warning is for "equipment" and not "facilities."

I'm starting to think that it's a catch-all liability disclaimer put on all products, given that it names every allergen that has to be labeled -- which is not very helpful to those of us who rely on allergen statements.

Label: Neutral
Summary: 3.5 stars for a good idea that costs too much
Content:
I love Splenda and have been using it since it first debuted on the market. Unlike other artificial sweeteners, it has no aspartame (which I am allergic too). It also dissolves easily in hot and cold drinks. For the last 6 months, I've been counting calories to lose weight and control my portions better. When I saw the new enriched Splenda, I decided to give it a try because I had a coupon. I drink a lot of hot tea to help curb my snack cravings, and I thought the added fiber might make a cup feel more filling. While I'm not sure if it is more filling, I have noticed that the Splenda with fiber is sweeter to me. I used to use 2 packets of Splenda in my tea, but only need one of these. I'm not sure if this is because each packet has more in it, or if the fiber enhances the sweetness. Otherwise, it tastes the same as regular Splenda.

However, this product also has some disadvantages that will keep me from buying it regularly. First, as another reviewer noted, the packets are not simple paper. They are foil-lined to keep the fiber from hardening the Splenda. While I understand the necessity, it is inconvenient. I often spill a little trying to open them because I can't shake the granules to the bottom first. Second, it does not dissolve as easily, especially in cold liquids. It will dissolve, you just need to add it more slowly and stir a lot. Finally, and most critically, Splenda essentials are a LOT more expensive. A 400 count box of regular Splenda is $11 on Amazon Subscribe & Save as of this writing. In contrast, the Splenda Essentials with B vitamin or Antioxidants (the fiber is not yet available) are almost $15 for 320 packets. I found a similar price differential in my local grocery store and at Wal Mart.

Overall, if these were the same price as regular Splenda, I wouldn't hesitate to recommend them. As it is, I won't buy them again unless I have a coupon that makes it worth while. It's a good idea; especially to add vitamins to your diet in something you already use regularly. But, it's not worth the price hike.

Label: Neutral
Summary: Great cookies but check the expiry date!
Content: Bought the 3oz double chocolate chip cookies and liked them so much that also subscribed to these raisin oatmeal mini cookies. (the 3oz one was a big too big for me) 48 cookies arrived and as I checked the expiry date (or best before date) I realized I only had about 2 weeks to finish the 48 cookies. Great cookies and great deal if freshness can be guaranteed!

Label: Neutral
Content: good taste, but it needs more protein.  nice that's it's all natural though, nice snack...  those deep chocolate ones, though, i think they are worth it!

Label: Neutral
Content: It seems to have more carrots than other brands and also seems to have more "juice to veggie" ratio than other brands.

Label: Neutral
Content: You get tired of it fairly easily. I thought having a pack of 6 would prevent me from buying any more mints, but I couldn't even finish it. It got too tangy!

Label: Neutral
Content: This product was very oily as the other reviewer said. It also had a strong roasted chipotle type flavor and the cloves are very strong as well. It was not my style of basmati.  If you love cloves and cinnamon and such than this will be a good product for you to try, but if you aren't into cloves then you should probably pass. I also didn't think the cloves flavor married with the roasted flavor.  It wasn't like the roasted flavor in the eggplant dishes I've had.

Label: Neutral
Content:
My puppy eats these, but she doesn't seem to -love- them like other treats. The treats are kinda hard and my puppy makes a small mess on our floor with it but she eventually cleans most of it up.

They do make her breath smell good, like Garlic.

Label: Neutral
Content: My twins love this!! BUT Walmart sells them for $1/ for a 2pack!  Worth going there to save the extra $!

Label: Neutral
Content: I would rather have real almond butter on a cracker, but this is good for travel or if u are on the run!

Label: Neutral
Content:
I bought these chocolates for my son's 1st birthday party and ordered them 3 weeks in advance hoping that they would arrive on time. The seller called and assured me that they would arrive on time. The package was sent in 2 separate boxes (one sent priority mail the other sent express mail. Only one box arrived on time. I only had half of the amount of party favors for my son's party. This was probably a mistake in shipping by the sender, but nonetheless a problem.

The chocolates themselves are wonderful. They taste great and look awesome. If you decide to purchase this product, I would suggest you talk to the seller and make sure that the shipping is made on time to arrive for your event. If you can get some sort of guarantee shipping date that would be great too.

Label: Neutral
Content: I bought both the Chocolate coated and the Lemon Biscotti; while the lemon is quite tasty, I feel that the chocolate is not as sweet and is superior to the lemon in taste.

Label: Neutral
Summary: only rated well bc of price and low(er) sodium
Content:
These are not flavorful snacks that will satisfy you if you have a craving for the crunchies. If that is what you are looking for, try the Noi products (Tom Yum flavor is amazing).
These are bland and thin.
I give it props for the price.

Label: Neutral
Summary: Great product but almost twice the price
Content:
My kid - and others - love these. We can't buy enough of them. Trader Joe's have occasionally been out of them
but has not been permanent. At our local one, they have been back in stock for quite a while now and we fortunately have
no trouble getting large quantities of them. I was looking for some type of bulk deal but I admit my first reaction
to having found this was the same as the first reviewer... why would I pay so much more? I suppose it's possible I
may change my tune later... The product itself is great. "Good and good for you."

Label: Neutral
Content: I LOVE Nestle Rich Hot Cocoa and I was so excited to find it on Amazon for a reasonable price, but I was really disappointed with the condition of the cans once I got the box they came in opened. Two of the six cans I ordered were crushed on top and one can had a massive gash in it which caused some product to spill out during shipping. This was really disappointing as chocolate isn't cheap. I was also incredibly nervous about using the product not knowing if the gash was man-made or if it was the result of improper handling from the warehouse? Consumers cannot be too careful these days with past cases of product tampering. Overall, I was satisfied with the length of time it took for me to receive the product. I just wish the presentation would have been better. Canned foods should NEVER have holes or gashes in them and crushed cans are usually caused from poor packaging.

Label: Neutral
Summary: Good product, price not so hot
Content: If you cannot find this on the grocery shelf, this is a good source.  At $1.38 per ounce, it's actually pricier than buying a box of 8 packets at my grocery store, where the price is $1.28 per ounce.  Weird.

Label: Neutral
Content: The lowest calorie count that still has some flavor, although the flavor isn't much to write home about; we make it with fat-free milk which makes a good morning drink; frequently hard to find in grocery stores, thus ordering on-line is a necessity.

Label: Neutral
Content: When I ordered a large amount of these books to share with child care providers, I was greatly disappointed in what arrived for the amount I paid. I was expecting a larger book, not the 4x5 inch book that was delivered.  It looked like something that was created off of a copy machine.

Label: Neutral
Summary: This book is much too small
Content: It was a great price, but I can't read it to my class. It is like a little travel brochure.

Label: Neutral
Content: This book was purchased to be used in a classroom setting for read-a-loud purposes.  The small size of the book(4X6)makes that almost impossible.  The book itself is very cute and flows nicely, but is best shared with only one child at a time.

Label: Neutral
Summary: Way overpriced online due to shipping charges, but otherwise great product
Content: I love Innova EVO pet food and so do my two cats. Very healthy, great quality food and I was glad to see that Innova EVO's dry cat food line have expanded on their formulas (more variety: e.g. chicken, fish, etc.). My only gripe was that the shipping made this a much more expensive item than if I had purchased it directly from my local downtown pet store!

Label: Neutral
Content: The Bonsai tree is a Bonsai tree.  That is about the only positive we can report.  It did not arrive in a timely manner. The additional cost for shipping and handling almost doubled the price.  The container is just a container nothing impressive.  It, however, the product ordered just not impressive.  A local garden outlet would be a better source for this product.

Label: Neutral
Content: Ordered these for my grandson's birthday, he was excited when he opened them and so we passed them around - didn't taste as fresh as I thought they should have, kind of embarrasing in front of friends and relatives - will not purchase these again - will buy them in the store and hope for the best.

Label: Neutral
Content: This milk is OK... I buy their 2% white milk which is amazing so I decided to try the flavored milk. I was expecting something rich and creamy unfortunately this was not that.

Label: Neutral
Summary: Thinner and not as strong as I expected
Content: These are not bully sticks. They are much thinner and lighter. Our dog ate them very fast and it didn't take much chewing. At least they don't smell bad like some brands of bully sticks. What you pay is what you get...

Label: Neutral
Summary: beefy sticks- not good for tough chewers
Content: My dog loved these, but chewed them up in what seemed like seconds. They are not hard enough for tough chewers. I would recommend these for small dogs and dogs that aren't hard chewers.

Label: Neutral
Summary: These are not bully sticks, nor do they last long
Content:
The other reviews are correct that say these "beefy sticks" aren't to be confused with "bully sticks". While this Smokehouse product has similar pricing to bully sticks, they simply aren't bully sticks. They aren't long lasting at all. Because of the high price of these beefy sticks and they're more of a quickly consumed treat rather than a long lasting chew, I took 2 stars off the rating.

My 30 lbs sheltie girl ate hers in less than 3 minutes and she's a lady-like eater, not a gulper. But both shelties of mine do enjoy these beefy sticks greatly, so it gets 3 stars for what it is, a treat or a very quick chew. I just won't buy them again. True bully sticks are the way to go if you want something that will occupy your furry chewer's time. A really thick bully (I buy the full 36" bully canes, otherwise known as "walking sticks") will take my kids nearly 2 hours of steady chewing to get a few inches off of it.

In short, if you're looking for a quick chew that's rather expensive, these Smokehouse beefy sticks are just that.

Label: Neutral
Content: I didn't realize these bones were so thin. I had assumed they were chew bones, but instead were actually a treat. If you are looking for something to occupy your dog for an hour, these aren't it. My 11 week old puppy chainsawed through one in no time. I really needed something to keep him chewing for a while, something that wasn't my couch or shoes. I'll keep looking...

Label: Neutral
Content: my cavalier king charles has loved these since he was 3 months old and he is 1 yr and 2 months now. But they are so expensive!!! They are cheaper on wal mart 6.81 for 6.

Label: Neutral
Summary: Not as strong as regular bully sticks
Content: I bought these for my pitbull puppy since he feels the need to chew everything in sight. These are not as thick/strong as regular bully sticks so he can go through one in about 5 minutes. On the plus side they dont smell awful so I guess its kind of a trade off. Not bad for the price.

Label: Neutral
Content: If you just really have to have an ESE machine and want good espresso you can't go wrong will illy.  But if you don't care about having a true espresso machine with a yucky portafilter that you have to keep clean then you should just go for the iPerespresso pods and machine instead.  I have compared these literally side-by-side and the complexity, intensity, and body of the iPerespresso shot just totally blows away the ESE shot, not to mention there is ZERO cleanup, but you are stuck with the pier pods, but who cares.  for 10 cents more a cup you get a truly perfect shot every single time of great illy espresso.

Label: Neutral
Content: I paid $5.46 for this and bc of this am happy with the purchase. It's quality and tasty product but the 12 boxes definitely are smaller than I normally buy at the store. Good deal, for that price, but I wouldn't purchase again.

Label: Neutral
Summary: Note: Rating both coffee and seller
Content:
This coffee is good but, for me, it's nothing special. I will buy it again because it's a nice, mellow blend, and my favorite daily coffee, Nabob, must now be shipped from Canada. However, on my first order to the Canadian company, it's taking a long time to be delivered (still haven't gotten it).

The reason for only three stars is not about the quality of the coffee but the fact that the description of the product does not mention the fact that this "Kona coffee" is actually only 15% Kona. If you look very carefully at the photo of the disc, you can see that information, and there's a legal disclaimer saying that the product may not match exactly with the description. So it's my fault for not reading more carefully, but I was happy to see what I thought was 100% Kona and wasn't careful. I've bought the 15% Kona before in a local store and did know that there was such a product in the Tassimo discs, but I just read the product title and ordered.

As I said, the coffee tastes good, the amount of coffee is the usual amount, neither the small cups of some European coffees or the extra large size, and I would recommend the coffee. Just be aware that this is blended coffee with only 15% Kona. And don't expect it to come in a flash, as it did when Amazon Prime delivered it.

Label: Neutral
Content: A little disappointed.  The ravioli taste OK, but too few of them.  Product has a lot of liquid; and although it has a pretty good flavor, there is a lot more of it than is needed for the amount of pasta.  Best if combined with vegetable to absorb all the excess sauce.  I use sweet potato, mashed.

Label: Neutral
Content:
Most of these meals have too much salt. This one could use just a bit more salt, and a bit less spice.

The trick with this one is to let it sit a bit out of the microwave so the heat spreads more evenly, or you'll burn your mouth on the hot spots.

This is a decent dish. Add a little salt and some grated cheese and it's even better.

Label: Neutral
Summary: It's definitely NOT a Starbucks or CoffeeBean Chai Tea Latte!
Content: I am a BIG fan of Starbucks and CoffeeBean's Chai Tea Latte.  And was so excited to buy this product hoping that it would replace my $4 habit.  But I was dissapointed.  Another reviewer that gave it a good rating stated that "it smells wonderful...tasting like a liquid pumpkin pie...Sweet, creamy and somewhat spicy".  Well, it is sweet and creamy but not spicy like my favorite Chai Tea Latte.  It just doesn't even come close to that taste...but I have convinced myself that even though I'm giving up on the taste, I'm saving at least $3 per cup if not more.  And, yes, you can taste the splenda...and I can say that because I am a splenda fan.  Overall, I only gave it a three star because it's not a bad tasting item, but just not what I expected it to taste.  Maybe the wonderful aroma alone could satisfy you...

Label: Neutral
Summary: I was a fan but now? Not so much...
Content:
I used to love drinking this chai tea. I thought it was a good blend of sweet and spice to create the great chai taste. However lately when I have drank it, it tastes too artificial to me. Perhaps its the Splenda in it which once warmed up makes it taste this way. I'm not too sure but the fact it uses Splenda now is a big turn-off to begin with.

I wish the taste had never changed since I was a loyal drinker of it. Now? Not so much and not at this price!

Label: Neutral
Content: If you don't send water through the same tea disc a 2nd time, and don't add sugar, you will taste too much nutmeg over a cheap assam or green tea (which tastes like dirt). I also squirted some light whip cream in it and over it. After trying the undrinkable Gevalia cappaccino, I was relieved to find something I liked. The creamer isn't bad in this one. I don't know if it's a different kind or if it is a good combination of seasoning. I gave it 3 stars because for this price, Twinings should have used a better grade of tea. It tastes pretty good now, but there is still that lingering aftertaste of earthy tea. With the milk, it fills my insulated glass 3/4 of the way full. One other feature, it smells wonderful brewing! It IS Thanksgiving in a cup (thermal glass, I mean.) As a price comparison, using the 20% coupon at Bed, Bath, & Beyond, who sells it for $10.99, regularly, for the 16 disc (8 servings) pkg. and with their free standard shipping, it comes to $1.09 per serving before tax.

Label: Neutral
Summary: Splenda? My boyfriend loves it anyway.
Content:
Whoah. I had NO IDEA there was Splenda in this! Maybe that's why I don't particularly care for it.
I mean, it's good, and drinkable, but... not my cup of tea... (you see what I did there??)

The initial smell is awesome, but I do prefer the Wawa or Strabucks Chai Tea..

However, my boyfriend LOVES this stuff. He drinks it in a huge cafe mug, 2 (well 4 counting all that cream) discs at a time! And then thinks about going back for more!

Hey, Tassimo sells Starbucks products, maybe they will eventually get a Starbuck's Chai Tea Disc set for us to enjoy!?

Label: Neutral
Summary: O-Ring Failure!!  Great taste but tea leaves don't stay in the disc
Content:
I've purchased this product several time before, and never had this problem.
I currently am working on my first batch of a 2 pack shipment, so I'm hoping this problem doesn't continue.
The first 3 discs were ok, but the last 2 cups have had the tea leaves come out of the disc and into my cup.
The first time it happened I figured it out by getting a mouthful of them. The second time, I watched the machine closely, and examined the disc afterward. Seems like there is a production problem with the discs.
The disc gets very bloated, and the inside seal that keeps the contents inside, seems to fail.
I made some regular coffee immediately afterward, and didn't have any grounds seep out, so I think the problem is unique to these discs. These are too expensive to have this happen even on one or two.
The product tastes WONDERFUL, but this problem is too serious too risk continued purchase of these.

Label: Neutral
Content:
I read all the other reviews and have not seen anybody else experiencing the problem that I am having.

Overall the tea is very good, but sometimes when I make it, the crushed up tea leaves end up in my cup. I don't have this problem with any of the other products and the machine is always cleaned after every use.

So I would not buy this product again, because of the problem I am having with it.

Label: Neutral
Content: I love Demetris regular and extra horseradsih, but the Chipotle is really hot. I like hot food, wings etc but this was just too hot alone.  Now I use the extra horseradish mix and put a dash of this in too kick it up. But be warned, this is really hot

Label: Neutral
Summary: Astringent aftertaste, no foil or paper packaging
Content: I really enjoy Ahmad English tea #1, so I tried thier Earl Grey. It has an astringent aftertaste, is too strong, and this particular box has no individual packaging to seal the flavor in. I prefer not to use foil wrapped products for environmental reasons but these packets need to be in an airtight container so as not to loose thier flavor. I really cannot taste much bergamot which is what I enjoy about an Earl Grey. Also, it smells too perfumey for me. I'll stick to Twinings Earl Grey.

Label: Neutral
Content: Healthier it seems from regular Jell-o and that is always good. 3 Stars because I found it to be more pricey than others and the flavor was fine but did not in the end made a whole lot of difference. Jello is jello is jello and basically there are no surprises. Valued the lack of coloring and unhealthy ingredients. So why do I rate them 3 Stars instead of 4 or more? Well, the company send me an email through amazon promising a little extra if I took the time to review them, which I always almost do anyhow, but since they offered I took them at their word. I know on my first review, prior to this one, I was more generous with the stars system but this time around I am cutting down in the enthusiasm and allocate 3.5. Nice Jello, apparently many swear to the grand taste and advantage of this one but it is so hard to get too excited about Jello.

Label: Neutral
Content: Great price on this special. After having some of this coffee at a high end restarant in Sedona AZ I thought I would order some, It had a fair amount of bittetness which was not present in the  restaurant version  The brewer machine I use does better on starbuck's.  It is good but not as good as I expected or hoped for.  Still a great purchase price

Label: Neutral
Content: I buy this vodka sauce when my store is out of the much more flavorful Bertolli Vodka Sauce. Wolfgang Puck's version of creamy vodka sauce is a more bland-tasting sauce that doesn't add much kick to pasta dishes. I find myself having to add my own touch (seasoning) to it. In a bind, this vodka sauce will do; I'm just a little curious as to why this sauce doesn't have any punch. It more or less tastes like spaghetti sauce. Is it really a creamy spaghetti sauce? Not to mention the price is higher than a lot of sauces out there. Avoid this sauce if you can.

Label: Neutral
Summary: Not the freshest product - chemical taste
Content: Compared with the black licorice Haribo, this product seemed not as soft and fresh.  Some pieces also seemed to have an unpleasant chemical taste to them.  It's hard to know whether this was just a stale package or if the formulation differences between the licorice flavor and strawberry flavor cause the significantly worse texture in the strawberry product, but if one really loves strawberry licorice, you can still manage to enjoy this product.  Overall, somewhat disappointing.  Not sure that I would buy this again.

Label: Neutral
Content: The taste of these is great, but our bag was a little dry and chewy.  That said, the party kids ate them up without hesitation and loved unrolling them.  Might consider buying them again, but we've had our fill for a while.

Label: Neutral
Content: The strawberry licorice wheels are pretty good.  My biggest complaint is the slime.  You don't think you ought to have to wash your hands after having licorice but with these you do.  They have a pretty good flavor and tend to be addicting (what candy isn't).  Just know what you are getting into because 5 lbs is a lot of candy.

Label: Neutral
Summary: Not great, but not bad either.
Content: These candies were not bad and I will probably buy again, but I was disappointed.  They are very chewy (almost tough) and just taste like an inexpensive candy.  Ironically, in the same order, I also purchased the black licorice wheels (also by Haribo) packaged in the smaller bags.  In contrast, the black licorice wheels were very fresh, moist and tasty.  I think whether or not a person likes the red wheels simply depends upon their individual taste.  If the red ones presented like the black ones (moist, fresh and very tasty), I would be very pleased.  Perhaps it would be helpful to describe the red ones as an "ordinary" and the black ones as "gormet."

Label: Neutral
Content: These were purchased as favors/part of centerpiece but I expected them to be much larger.  Make sure you take a look at a ruler before you order.

Label: Neutral
Summary: Good meal - If you spiff it up
Content:
I confess. I am not a vegetarian. However I purchased these to consider bringing on a trip as a self-contained meal.

First of all - This comes in a can just bit bigger than a tuna can, with a peel-off cover. It includes salt, pepper, and a spork. The meal says it has "2 servings." However, in most cases (unless you are sharing with a friend) you will eat both servings yourself.

For the entire can, the food values are:
Fat 10g
Sodium 720 mg
Carbs 52g (Fiber 14g - Sugars 4g)
Protein 10g
Total Calories 340

I tried this first as an "on the go" meal taking just a few bites out of the room-temperature can. I wasn't thrilled.

So I emptied the can into a bowl and added an ounce of shredded cheese and a small piece of leftover chicken breast (cut up). I ate it with a small pack of Cheez-its and really did enjoy it as a meal.

While I don't recommend this as an "eat out of the can meal," I do think it has possibilities as a side dish. So, 3 stars.

Label: Neutral
Content: This product is just okay.  I think it needs more garlic.  I love strong garlic taste and this one had a mild taste.

Label: Neutral
Content:
Your satisfaction with this product will depend on how you eat it. This is not the kind of cereal you pour into a bowl, add milk and eat immediately. Unfortunately, the cereal is very hard; I would not call it crunchy, it's just plain hard.

There are two ways around this. I customarily pour this cereal on top of plain yogurt, add milk and let it sit in the fridge overnight. By morning, the cereal is soft but not soggy. Of course it's not crunchy/crispy either but when you eat gluten-free you tolerate a lot. Alternatively, you can add milk or water to the cereal and heat it in the microwave. It's actually good this way, like a form of oatmeal.

I don't mind the flavor, but again, I've been eating gluten-free for 3 years and know not to expect too much. I do like the fact that a serving provides 5 grams of fiber (more challenging to get on a gluten-free diet) and is fortified with vitamins and minerals.

Label: Neutral
Content:
Pluses - 1) it does contain the organic ingredients I was looking for, and 2) it's gentle on the stomach.
Minuses - 1) the taste isn't great. I had to use honey, which I prefer not to do. 2) the loose leaf ingredient particles are tiny, so they're small enough to leak out of my infuser. Cheesecloth baggie works much better.

Label: Neutral
Content: These will be great for my daughter when she's over a year old or so, but at 11 months, she is not quite ready for something this large and crunchy.  They don't dissolve easily like the Gerber lil crunchies or puffs and I had to dig a whole wagon wheel out of her mouth so she wouldn't choke because she put the whole thing in there and it just sat there without dissolving, even using her teeth and gums to try to mash them.  They are about the size of a quarter so I tried cutting them up into cheerio size pieces but they still just sit on her tongue and don't dissolve and she has a hard time swallowing even the smaller pieces.  I bought a bunch in bulk so I will save them for when she's a little older.  I just wanted other parents to be careful what ages these wagon wheels are fed to.

Label: Neutral
Summary: Great product but I don't like the packaging
Content: I love these and my 8 month old loves them but I don't think the product canister does a good job of keeping them fresh.  It seems like they go stale VERY fast.  I don't think the baby cares but since I eat them with her it bothers me.

Label: Neutral
Content: My son is now 9 months old, he has been eating finger foods for a few months now. We first purchased the Gerber Graduates Mild Cheddar & he loves them! They do just melt in the mouth, perfect because he only had 5 teeth at the time. The only negative I have for these is some of the puffs are fairly large! If I give my son a handful of them, he stuffs them in his mouth, so the larger ones make me nervous. I ususally cut them in half. My new find would be the Target Up & Up brand - they are fairly cheaper & they are all the same size (perfectly smaller) So from now on, I will be saving a few bucks, and using those!

Label: Neutral
Summary: Not a complete discripton of product given
Content: I have never purchased tart cherries before. I was elated to find them on the Internet.  However, when I opened the package I discovered that the package contains not only tart cherries, but also sunflower oil, which I must avoid.  Had I known this from the discription, I would not have purchased them.

Label: Neutral
Content:
Last time I ordered the same flowers and the bouquet was really good and lasted a while.

This time the size was smaller and it lasted half the time.

Not happy with the inconsistency.

Label: Neutral
Summary: Dry and Not as Appealing as other treats
Content: I love the idea of this dog treat, that it cleans teeth and freshens breath.  However, to get the maximum effect of that, the box suggests feeding him two bones a day every day for the cleanest teeth.  I normally don't treat my dog that often, because I don't think it's that good for him and also the cost of treats.  I'd have to buy a box a week to keep up with that!  But as to the taste of it, my dog was very unappealed by it.  He still ate them, as he is a dog afterall, but he would put it down and come back to it and work on it almost in the way he does actual dry bones.  I just think it lacks the taste and therefore his interest.  He much prefers tastier treats as he gobbles them up or spends his time gnawing on his bones. But I still give 3 stars as it does seem to help his teeth and breath!  Now if they could just make it more appetizing.  My guy is not, by far, a picky eater, so if he's pickin' there's a problem!

Label: Neutral
Content: these might be good for cleaning your dog's teeth, but so far I haven't been able to get my dogs to eat them - they just hide them.  Hopefully they will start eating them eventually.

Label: Neutral
Summary: Dogs liked it better than I did
Content:
Hartz isn't the brand that comes to mind when I consider 'quality' dog treats, and I wasn't sure mine would eat them. My "small" dog weighs in at 25 lbs, and these biscuits were just right for her. Her big sister, at 65 lbs, did also have to chew them before swallowing. I also tried them on my boss's crew of 5 miscellaneous dogs, and they all ate them except the one who won't eat anything. I wouldn't put much faith in their effectiveness as teeth cleaners though.

As a "dog mom", I was not impressed with the ingredients. These biscuits had far too many ingredients that just didn't measure up as "health encouraging" to inspire much faith on my part. I can find treats that are far healthier, and chews that are far better as tooth cleaners than these biscuits do either one.

All in all, its a 3 star ho-hum product. Nothing to get excited about, and I won't be excited enough to seek them out at the store either!

Label: Neutral
Summary: Better than green beans, not as good as kitty poop
Content:
My Boston Terrier eats these, but does not appear to enjoy them any more than Milkbones. They are very hard and crunchy, which should be good for cleaning their teeth as advertised.

My ancient Pekingese mix (with a very small mouth, and snaggly, horrible teeth) either can not, or will not chew them. She just holds them in her mouth or sets them down. I broke one in half to see if the size was the problem, but she still did not eat it.

I did not try these myself, but I'm going to say that my household consensus is that these are not a favorite.

Label: Neutral
Summary: A bit large for a small mouth, but definitely enjoyed
Content:
Length:: 1:59 Mins

What better way to review a dog biscuit than to show how much a dog enjoyed eating it? That was my logic behind this very amateurish but heartfelt video review starring my 1 1/2-year-old Shih Tzu, Missy.

The video was very impromptu and, in hindsight, I realize that I didn't do a great job of explaining why I only gave the product 3 stars, so I'm adding some further explanation here.

First, I took a star off because I felt that if you're going to make a multi-sized dog biscuit, the small should be small enough for the very small breeds like Yorkies and Chihuahuas. As you can see in the video, this small biscuit is not only 2 inches long and quite thick but VERY hard, so I feel like a very small or more delicate breed may have trouble with even the small biscuit.

Second, the ingredient list on the box is almost 3 inches long. Sugar and salt are within the first 10 ingredients and, while there are a lot of vitamins and minerals included, there is also partially hydrogenated vegetable oil, several food colorings and chemicals I can hardly pronounce. I just prefer to feed Missy more natural foods and snacks.

Third, the "feeding instructions" (which hardly seemed necessary) direct me to give Missy 2 biscuits twice a day. That's 4 large (compared to the small Mother Hubbard bone-shaped treats she usually gets) treats a day, which seemed a bit much, especially much considering my issues with the ingredient list.

Label: Neutral
Summary: the smalls not small enough for small dogs
Content: I guess when they did the taste test for these and stated preferred two to one sadly my dog (Chloe) was sitting in the other group. I have a 12 lbs. Papillon and give her the competitor bones and she loves those. I don't think it was the flavor as much as the size with these. For being `small' the bones are twice as large as the other ones. I think that was the issue for my `Chloe', she could not get her poor small mouth around it. She would try to suck it until it was ready to break. Even if I broke it, the pieces were too thick. I think if they were not so thick she would not have any issues. As far as the breath factor I did notice it improved in that area! That alone I would buy them but the size is what would deter me. I gave some to a bigger dog, a 55 lbs lab mix and he did not have a problem chewing them but still had to break the bone up. Over all I think it is a good idea but the size is not what I would consider small. Maybe a small treat for a bigger dog but too big for small dogs.

Label: Neutral
Content: This is a very large dog cookie that has 170 calories -- roughly what my dog would get if I fed him a candy bar.  The package says that for maximum benefit I should feed two of these to my dog a day -- 340 empty calories.  While my dog eats these enthusiastically and wouldn't object, that won't be happening any time soon.  The downside of this product is obvious, while the benefit of its contribution to cleaner teeth is much harder to assess.

Label: Neutral
Summary: My dog wasn't big on these...
Content:
I got these treats for my extra large Chihuahua who will eat anything. She wasn't a fan of these. Whenever we decide to give her a treat we ask her if she wants a "snackee" & she gets very excited. She'll run in circle & stand on her hind legs. When we gave her this for a "snackee" she just looked at it, smelled it & then looked to us like we were joking her. We left it there & she looked at it again & smelled it & then chose to walk away from it. This dog turns down nothing except for lettuce. After it sat there for about 30 mins I put it in her dog dish & about 6 hours later she decided to get it out & contemplate eating it for about 10 more minutes before she decided to finally try it. She did finally eat all of it but we know she wasn't big on it because the next couple times we gave her one it was the same routine, it sat for hours before being eaten.

Her opinion is that she's not big on them & wouldn't recommend them but if given one she'll eventually eat it to make it go away.

Label: Neutral
Content:
These biscuits are probably better than nothing, and they did seem to clean some of the yellowish gunk off his teeth; after three of these over the span of a weekend, my dog's teeth were noticeably whiter, although spots of tartar and plaque remained in the remoter portions of his teeth.

I generally prefer organic dog food with short, simple ingredient lists, and at first was a little concerned when I saw that the list on these things was half the height of the box. However, spot checking the ingredients shows that most of them (Calcium Pantothenate or Pyridoxine Hydrochloride for example) were just vitamin supplements; a few were harder to decipher, though (Sodium Hexametaphosphate?) The most common ingredient is wheat, so if your dog has a wheat allergy, avoid these.

As to taste, I refrained from trying them myself, but it did seem a bit dryer and more powdery than other treats I feed him; he didn't seem as wildly enthusiastic about them as he is about his organic kibble, but he sure ate every speck, and started noticing when I got the box out. (To be fair, he'd probably eat bark if I put it in a bowl with some kibble and water).

Overall, these are probably a good option if you want to do something for your dog's teeth; they're certainly far cheaper than the other dog dental treats I've seen for sale. I don't think they're going to be an adequate substitute for getting your dog's teeth cleaned at the vet, though.

Label: Neutral
Summary: Dogs love them! But certainly not a dental supplement.
Content: I have 2 dogs, a sheltie mix and long haired chiauaua, I will say that the "LARGE" size biscuits were way to big for both of my dogs so I broke the large biscuit in half and gave each dog a piece of it. The dogs loved them! In fact I went to my front door to get the box and normally my dogs don't get excited about boxes. But this time I guess they could smell the treats inside because they both went crazy! I'll say that the box is bigger then I expected, contains approx 16 biscuits. The "serving size" on the box I'm not sure about as it says "for best results give 2 twice a day. If my math is right they want you to feed your dog a total of 4 of these a day and at that rate the box will last 3 and a half days.  If the treats were healthier and not so much filler I wouldn't see a problem with this IF it really helps the teeth, but with it being mostly filler I couldn't see feeding my dogs 4 of these every day. They are a good treat every now and then, but certainly not to be used as an on-going dental treatment because you would go through 2 boxes a week and at the current price it would be about $48 a month and that is just for 1 dog. These in my opinion are purely TREATS and not dental supplements. I will be submitting a picture of my dogs with these treats if you would like to see how excited they were when I got them out! I rated these at 3 out of 5 simply because of the healthiness of these compared to the "recommended serving." As far as my dogs go, I think they would give it a 5.

Label: Neutral
Content: Reviewing dog biscuits is a little difficult. Did my golden retriever eat the biscuits? Yes, quite readily.  Did her teeth and breath get noticeably cleaner? Perhaps, but having only tried one box--which lasted a couple of weeks--I am not sure I can guarantee such a result.  Like all dog treats, they seem to recommend a lot per day.

Label: Neutral
Content: I have two Shih-Tzu/Pomeranian mix dogs that can be a bit finicky when it comes to what they eat. It did take them a while to warm up to these, but now they seem to love them. One of them will eat every crumb, then go check to see if his brother left any crumbs. Though I don't think these will ever replace my dogs' favorite "Greenies," these are a good change of pace for them.

Label: Neutral
Content:
I love the idea of a dog biscuit that will freshen your doglies breath. I have 5, so I'm always trying different dental bones and things to help me out there. These bones are the perfect size, smell great~~like human food, actually~~but out of 5 dogs, only 2 would eat them. I actually put one in my youngest dog, Tobey's mouth, and tried to coax him. He spit it back out!! Not sure if it was the smell, or the taste, but I hate to report that it would be a waste of money for me to buy these. I have 4 Lhasa Apsos, and a Schneagle~~the Lhasa's I do have to say are pretty picky eaters, and 3 of them are the ones who wouldn't touch them, so take that as you will.
I WISH they loved them so that they COULD Crunch n' Clean!!

Label: Neutral
Summary: Dogs give them 5 stars... their dentist not so much
Content:
These biscuits are advertised to "clean" your dogs teeth. My dogs were very happy and willing participants in the experiment. They loved the biscuits (but frankly... if it comes from a human hand, they will gulp it down even if it were garbage... they're dogs... that's how they're wired).

However, after using these, I couldn't really tell a difference in the cleanliness of my dogs teeth.

If you want to give your dogs a treat, these will work great. However, don't expect them to replace regular cleanings at your dogs at the vet.

[NCJVR]

Label: Neutral
Content:
These biscuits are huge, almost a meal. We have 3 dogs, and they did eat them, although they were sort of luke warm in the process. They did not bolt them down like they do with milkbone. We only had the one box and I did not notice any difference in the way their teeth looked or their "dog breath."

Because it is a vine product, I do not know if the price of the item is fair. I think I will just stick with Milkbone products.

Label: Neutral
Summary: she likes it, but what the heck is DentaShield?
Content:
We received Hartz Crunch 'n Clean biscuits through the Vine program, and our medium-sized dog can go through a large-sized biscuit in about a minute. She enjoys them, but I'm concerned about the patented ingredient, DentaShield. "Invented by researchers at Indiana University's School of Dentistry, the same researchers who developed flouride for you and me," DentaShield might be the sodium hexametaphosphate listed as the 5th ingredient after wheat flour, ground whole wheat, chicken meal, and wheat germ meal. It sounds like a salt, which isn't necessary to clean tartar from teeth, as the box claims. Other ways are better to clean dogs' teeth.

These biscuits are definitely loaded with non-essential ingredients like partially hydrogenated vegetable oil and artificial color (they're uniformly tan, so where's the color?). The blurb about the same researchers who developed fluoride set off warning bells, as many people know the issues with mass amounts of fluoride in our drinking water, but people unfamiliar with those issues may feel this is a good advertising tactic.

Our dog likes them, but dogs tend to like junk food, including human food. So, if you're conscientious about what you feed your critters, consider buying locally-made biscuits or make them yourself from a recipe online.

Label: Neutral
Summary: My dog isn't crazy about them
Content: Normally when I take out treats or bones for my dog she starts doing her tricks right away and whining in anticipation.  When I take this box out she doesnt even get up. When I hand her a bone she lets it drop to the floor and just sniffs it.  Sometimes she'll eventually eat it. Other times she just walks away from it.  I will update my review after she's been using them for a while to report back whether her teeth are any cleaner.  That's assuming I can get her to eat them.

Label: Neutral
Summary: My pups will eat anything--but they won't eat these unless they're the big ones
Content:
I haven't had the same success as other reviewers here. My two sibling dogs are Rhodesian Ridgeback/Beagle mixes, and they are basically breathing vacuum cleaners. If it hits the floor, they eat it. I normally treat them to Stop & Shop brand treats in the assorted flavors (and colors) because they love them. The medium sized Hartz Crunch n Clean biscuits have been spit out repeatedly by my two 55 pound dogs. I even broke them in two to make them smaller for my dogs' mouths and they still reject them. It seems to be not only the size, but the fact that these biscuits are extremely hard. I'm sure that is what helps remove tartar, but my dogs only like a tough chewing job when they are enjoying a rawhide bone.

On the other hand, the LARGE variety go over better, but not so much as quick treats but as if my dogs think I've just given them a rawhide to gnaw on. They're just in for a surprise when, after enough chewing of these hard bones, they actually break apart and become edible.

Some of the main ingredients include wheat flour, ground whole wheat, chicken meal, wheat germ meal, poultry fat, poultry digest, sugar, dried whey, malted barley flour, dried cane molasses, citric acid, corn starch, and partially hydrogenated vegetable oil. Aside from also having vitamins in the ingredients, these treats are loaded with ingredients that are hard to pronounce and sound like things you learned bout back in chemistry class!

Label: Neutral
Summary: My dog likes the other brand better.
Content: I gave a Hartz to my dog and he ate part of it and stopped. Then I gave him the "other" brand and he ate it up. So my dog only will eat this if there's nothing else around. It's hard to write a review since it's up to the dog whether he likes it or dislikes it. Each dog is different on what they feel is good so I didn't get to the point to see if it helped his teeth or not.

Label: Neutral
Summary: Mixed opionions from my two dogs.
Content:
I have 2 medium sized dogs, a siberian husky who is a bit of a picky eater and my puli who is a trash can. They both are typically fed Wellness brand products, so I wasn't sure how they would like the Crunch 'n Clean biscuits.
My puli, being the little trash can he is, stared at and played with a biscuit for a while before digging in, which is not his usual form. However, after a few minutes he snarfed it right up and he has continued to do so for the past several days.
My husky on the other hand initially left her biscuit and stared at it. Then she licked it and stared at me, leaving it on the ground and walking away. I tried again the next day with similar results. On day three she begrudgingly took it and ate it, but she left bits of it all over the floor, which is not her MO for our normal brand.
I think, therefore, it is likely that how well your dog will or won't like these treats is dependent on how finicky your dog is.

They do appear to assist with removal of food particles. I could not ascertain whether they assisted with tartar build-up removal as neither of my dogs really have this problem. However, if the loose food is removed, I suppose you could argue that it would reduce the potential for tartar build-up in the future. It did not make their breath smell remarkably different.

The caloric content is high considering the ingredient list (50 cal/biscuit). This could be a problem for anyone with pets that have weight issues as the recommended serving is 2 biscuits twice a day for 200 calories total. The ingredient list also sports a number of grain products, wheat, barley flower, and corn starch, which could be a problem if your pet has allergies. It also contains partially hydrogenated oils and sugars, neither of which are particularly good for either pets or people. So those people who worry about what their dogs eating, or those with pets with allergies will probably not find this product to their liking. I am most concerned with the calorie content and wonder if the reason I did not notice noticeably fresher breath was because I fed my dogs half the recommended serving (so 1 biscuit twice daily) as I have one pet whose weight I have to watch.

All in all I think this is a split decision. I think many dogs will like the biscuits, like my puli and be just fine with them. They are a good size for the medium breeds and they probably will prevent future tartar build-up. For finicky eaters and/or owners, or those pets who have grain allergies, a different choice may make more sense.

Label: Neutral
Content: Is it me, or does the description "full leaf" inspire the idea that the leaf is actually complete, or at least broken but sufficiently large? I was really looking forward to seeing actual rose leaves and full leaves, but instead the tea bags I got have leaves that are so small and broken, they are almost dust. Overall the tea is okay -- not great. Has a nice smell, but flavors far too fast and does not last through two steepings.

Label: Neutral
Content: You have to be careful of how long, and at what temperature you prepare this tea. I would recommend 180F and not a second over 5 minutes. This tea has a tendency to become extremely bitter very quickly. Another note, most of the fruit pieces will settle to the bottom of the bag, so make sure you get a good mix of leaves and fruit before you steep. If done properly it can taste very good, but again the margin of error on this one is slim.

Label: Neutral
Summary: Sliced Hard Chicken Hot Dogs for Cats!
Content: This product does not smell very well to me.  In fact, I have to use a fork to "tenderized" the pieces for my old kitty cat.

Label: Neutral
Summary: Poor quality ingredients, but my cat loves it.
Content: I bought this product because my older cat stopped eating the wellness dry and wet food I usually fed her.  She likes this food and she begs for it every morning and evening when it is time for her meal.  The ingredients are not quality ingredients but this food is keeping my kitty satisfied.

Label: Neutral
Content: I have found these to be convenient when on long road trips, or in small spaces such as a on a plane. However, while they are convenient bottles, they do not come with the nipple and so you will need to remember to bring that along. Also the bottle tends to leak. It may be because of the nipple I am using is not the recommended nipple. All in All, I do recommend them for on the go but they are not something I would recommend for everyday use.

Label: Neutral
Content: Fun to have such a selection of decaf teas, but they taste a lot alike.  I'll probably reorder the Spiced Rasberry, but not the collection.

Label: Neutral
Content: I bought this item because I loved it when I tried the candy before. However, the package I received was really hard, almost not chewable. I was fairly disappointed.

Label: Neutral
Content: I love bars in a couple different flavors, including chocolate chip. Mostly because they do not contain high fructose syrup, and also because they provide a healthy in between meals snack.

Label: Neutral
Content: All of the bars are of course past the expiration date. It doesn't affect the taste, but makes the bars break apart easily.

Label: Neutral
Content:
well....let me state first that we like this natural sugar. that said...when we received it...it must have come in contact with dampness either from the manufacturer or via shipping....each bag of sugar was hard. we had to bang it on the counter many times to break it up. have had it once before and it was fine. wasn't hard or lumpy but still smelled weird!

now for the unpleasant part....it does not smell like regular processed white sugar from supermarkets. it has an odor of cat pee. which i thought very peculiar. although...when you use it to cook with or put it in tea..coffee...cereal...this odor disappears completely. i guess it's the nature of the unrefined processing????

it's actually stronger than 'white' sugar! you don't need as much! and we will buy it again. just don't have a sensitive nose or keep your nose out of the sugar jar! and you'll be just fine!

Label: Neutral
Summary: Ceylon Tea Bags Smaller Than Most
Content: Overall I'd say this is a good buy. However the tea bags are smaller than usual, so you will only make one small cup per bag, and that will be a mild brew at that.  The thing that bugs me about these tea bags is that they float in you cup. They don't seem to want to absorb the water.

Label: Neutral
Content: I was not impressed with the flavor of this tea. It has a unique smell too. I try to drink it every now and then because it is suppose to be good for you. However, I prefer English breakfast tea.

Label: Neutral
Content: I'm a big oolong/wulong tea drinker. Good price, but the taste of this tea is just ok. Not my favorite. My service from Amazon was great, as usual.

Label: Neutral
Content: Grain was bought for gift to use for sprounting last winter, I think it was a little pricy but was handy for needs.

Label: Neutral
Summary: Not as remembered-but still tastes good
Content: while the flavor is remains the same, i notice that the color of the crackers is different than when i first purchased these crackers from a local retailer back in 2006. Back the, the crackers had the same coloring as the image on the box.  they now apprear to be more reddish in coloring.  Also, there is a lot of breakage within the package.  the shipping container and the cracker boxes themselves are in good shape, but more broken crackers than expected.

Label: Neutral
Content: This is a good product for those who want to relive the "nostalgia" of having eaten too much of the processed Spaghettio- type canned pasta as a kid.  I wouldn't want to get my kids hooked on the stuff though.  For those who are not a fan of the meatballs, I find that they are better when they break up in the sauce and you are just left with a crumbly, chewy texture overall.  That being said, this $2.50+ per can is a steep price to pay (plus, like I said, you don't rurally want to eat too often- it may be organic, but it's sure not health food).  Also, if you have the opportunity,  Whole Foods has numerous store brand versions of Annie's products.  They all seem pretty much the same to me, and they are a good deal cheaper.

Label: Neutral
Summary: The pasta is really goood, but the "meat"balls are really nasty!
Content: I've been a vegetarian for 10 months. I have tried Annie's Bunny Grahams and enjoyed them! I've recently started trying faux meat. Target had the  P'sghetti With Soy Meatballs one sale for $0.99 per can. I picked up a can and was eager to relive my childhood chef boy-ar-dee days. I cut one of the "meat"balls in half and ate it with a spoonful of pasta. My first thought was "this tastes gross!". I took another spoonful of pasta  with a tiny bit of the "meat"ball, so little that the tomato sauce would covered the taste. I enjoyed it! I ate tiny bits of the soy meatballs until all of the pasta was gone. I hated throwing them away, but just couldn't stand the taste of Annie's mock meat. I will load up on the plain pasta varieties!

Label: Neutral
Summary: Good but could be even better
Content:
It seems hard to find great muesli these days. I think this is one of the better ones, and I do buy it. However, I wish those making muesli would heed the latest nutritional advice. For example, nutritionists say that the ratio of omega-6 to omega-3 fatty acids is important and that we generally get too much of the omega-6 fatty acids and not enough of the omega-3's. This muesli would be a lot more nutritious if it replaced the large amount of sunflower seeds (high in omega-6 fatty acids) with walnuts (high in omega-3 fatty acids) and almonds. And to me that would make it taste better too. I also wish they would make a version without all the raisins and dates, allowing one to add fresh fruit (e.g., raspberries, blackberries, strawberries, etc.) instead of dried fruit.

I was in Australia last spring and found great muesli there not only meeting these nutritional criteria but tasting better than this or most other muesli. To me nuts are an important part of good muesli. But I'm being a bit of a purist, I know, and a friend tells me I'm a food snob, so take my opinion with that in mind!

Label: Neutral
Summary: Great, if you LOVE sunflower seeds!
Content: I am impressed by the overall quality of the ingredients that go into this product.  Very healthy, and I prefer to eat it without soaking as recommended.  However, there are an overwhelming amount of sunflower seeds, so much that they overwhelm all the other great ingredients.  I know it is an inexpensive filler and prices are skyrocketing, but after a few days, it gets really boring to eat when it tastes like nothing but sunflower seeds, bite after bite.

Label: Neutral
Summary: Wasn't Quite what I was expecting
Content: I was searching for muesli like I had eaten for breakfast almost everyday in London.  This wasn't quite the mix.  I think that flax seed tends to add a flavor that I don't like.  The cookie recipe on the package was pretty good.

Label: Neutral
Content:
I wanted to try something healthy and different. I've had meusli in Europe. They put little chocolate flakes in theirs and it makes a big difference. This stuff is not very exciting. Very little flavor. Not too sweet, which is good. I wish the oats were baked to make them crunchy.
But this is just me :-)

Cheers.

Label: Neutral
Content: I have to say, as far as taste its a 5 stare.  Though i was expecting 1 lb of fireballs would be more then what it is.

Label: Neutral
Content: It's better than average. But I agree that for the normal price ($10/12oz), you can get Intelligentsia or other really wonderful coffee. Regarding price, even the sale price/discount offers don't offer much better of a price than what you can do in the grocery store.

Label: Neutral
Content:
I found this coffee to be slightly better than the Eight O'Clock French Roast that I purchased on the same day. Honestly though, it makes me wonder if the beans sold in these bags are the same beans used at Starbucks.

The coffee seemed weak and astringent, and while certainly not without merit, it just doesn't seem to be worth the cost. The 3-pack sold here averages out to almost $10 a bag -- for $10, you can get something from Atomic Cafe or the Roasterie that will have you jumping out of bed every morning in anticipation of that first cup of TRULY excellent coffee.

Label: Neutral
Content:
Maybe it's because I've never had brisket strip "jerky" before, or maybe it was just the batch that I got, but these seemed much greasier than the usual products of this type. I had to tear bits of fat from each strip before I ate and I could still feel my mouth coated with grease as I chewed.

And again, this may have been related to my particular batch, but calling these "spicy" is laughable as I wasn't able to get a even a hint of a kick from any of the three bags I ordered. If I'd known that these were about as spicy as ketchup, I would not have ordered tham and will likely not order them again because I prefer my jerky to have at least a little heat.

Those complaints aside, this stuff is very tender and has a good and strong BBQ flavor (spicy or no). I've never eaten Stubb's BBQ, but if this is a reasonable approximation of what goes on in his restaurants, then I wouldn't hesitate in stopping and eating there. I'd just bring my own Tabasco.

Label: Neutral
Content: Pumpkin Spice was too weak in the spice flavors for me.  I brewed a second cup and used less water and it wasn't much better.  Will not buy it again.

Label: Neutral
Content:
I am a huge fan of Pumpkin Spice coffee, however, it just didn't come up to the depth and flavor of

Dunkin's. Having said that I am, however, a big fan of Green Mountain coffee and drink it daily.

Label: Neutral
Content: I love pumpkin spice coffee, but this is not nearly as good as the Gloria Jean pumpkin spice flavor.  I wish GJ's pumpkin spice were available in K-cups.

Label: Neutral
Summary: Note: Rating both coffee and seller
Content:
This coffee is good but, for me, it's nothing special. I will buy it again because it's a nice, mellow blend, and my favorite daily coffee, Nabob, must now be shipped from Canada. However, on my first order to the Canadian company, it's taking a long time to be delivered (still haven't gotten it).

The reason for only three stars is not about the quality of the coffee but the fact that the description of the product does not mention the fact that this "Kona coffee" is actually only 15% Kona. If you look very carefully at the photo of the disc, you can see that information, and there's a legal disclaimer saying that the product may not match exactly with the description. So it's my fault for not reading more carefully, but I was happy to see what I thought was 100% Kona and wasn't careful. I've bought the 15% Kona before in a local store and did know that there was such a product in the Tassimo discs, but I just read the product title and ordered.

As I said, the coffee tastes good, the amount of coffee is the usual amount, neither the small cups of some European coffees or the extra large size, and I would recommend the coffee. Just be aware that this is blended coffee with only 15% Kona. And don't expect it to come in a flash, as it did when Amazon Prime delivered it.

Label: Neutral
Content: It's a good bargain for $14 dollars a pound! But it's just your regular old jerky. No taste or anything, just your regular meat--regular jerky, you just get more bang for your buck!

Label: Neutral
Content: its really no better than that crap jack links. a lot of the pieces are to tough to chew and i eat real jerky all the time. this is only slightly better than jacks link. the only pro is its cheap. ill take quality over this next time. half of it is just dog food because of its poor quality. its not real beef jerky, its very moist and tough. i like real dry jerky. i had to spit some pieces out because they were to tough on my teeth... first time that has happen with beef jerky.

Label: Neutral
Content: I've tried a couple of other flavors of this brand and they were great, however, this pepper flavor was over the top. Way too much pepper for my taste. So much so that I couldn't eat more than a couple of pieces and I don't plan on eating any more of it.

Label: Neutral
Content: I bought 3 lbs on sale for about half off. The thickness and dryness was nearly perfect for how I like my jerky.  The flavor was good however it is loaded with garlic.  I don't mind the flavor of garlic in moderation, but this has so much it sticks with you all day.  I went through one bag and gave away the other two.  If I was a big fan of garlic I would have given it a 4-5 star rating, but since the type was labeled "original" and not "garlic" it was an un-welcomed surprise.

Label: Neutral
Summary: Make sure you refrigerate it after opening.
Content: Overall, pretty good jerky.  I had a bag open for about a week, and didnt know I had to refrigerate, and it started to get funky.

Label: Neutral
Content: The reviews I read said this stuff was great, I thought it was OK.  Nothing special, and I don't like the fact that you have to keep it in the refrigerator.

Label: Neutral
Summary: Could be great, but fell short!
Content: The flavor of this jerky was good-very sweet which my husband likes. However, the texture varied greatly from melt in your mouth to shoe leather that was almost not chewable. I like a little chewiness, so both textures bothered me.

Label: Neutral
Summary: Tender jerky in some bags not others
Content:
I really like the size of the pieces and the tenderness of the jerky I've had so far. I've only had one of the 4 packages that come in an order. I am not thrilled with the Teriyaki flavor but it's ok, not too salty. The sweet hot is really hot so beware. This brand is the first jerky I am willing to re-order, which says a lot. Usually I get grossed out by the amount of sinew in packaged jerky but I have not found much in this brand yet.

Updating after opening all 4 bags that came in an order: 3 bags were good but the 4th bag was all gristle and fat. There was not one piece that was edible in it. So they definitely have a quality control problem. Pity, because the good pieces are quite good, though the teriyaki flavor is a bit chemical for me. Still better than most other jerky brands

Label: Neutral
Content: This is a good tasting beef jerky but a little too salty and some pieces were too oily.

Label: Neutral
Content: While I read here the original flavor was natural, there was no list of ingredients available. And to my disappointment when this arrived it does indeed contain nitrites. The taste is alright, but I really would like to find jerky WITHOUT Nitrites or Nitrates. I've kept it in the fridge now for several months (i haven't had any mold issues) since I truly try to consume nitrites as little as possible, it will take a very long time to eat this or I'll end up trashing it. Please REVISE the description to be accurate! This brand DOES from my understanding have a truly natural version, that I cannot seem to find on Amazon.

Label: Neutral
Summary: Too much grissle in this jerky
Content:
This is really tasty jerky and the price is right, but ~20-30% of the jerky strips in the bags I purchased contained some sort of "gum-like" inedible grissle that I end up spitting out. I've bought 2 bags of this product approximately 30 days apart and both were like this. I'll try one more bag for the reasons I cite above, but if the next one is like the 1st two, I'm going to stop buying this product. It's a shame, because as I said, it really is tasty.

UPDATE FEB 2010
OK ... I've kept my monthly subscription to this Jerky ... What can I say ... Every 2nd or 3rd piece from the bags I've been delivered turns into a gum ball that I'm not willing to swallow, but it is just so darn tasty. Dunno how long I'll stay with this, but for now ... I sort of look forward to the monthly delivery.

Label: Neutral
Content: While tasting of hickory, the flavor was abit overdone. And some portions (oddly since this is dried) tasted rather greasy.

Label: Neutral
Content:
While "Wild Ride Beef Jerky Cowboy Strips" do have a good Hickory taste and are very tender (per treated), they are also fairly salty and leave a lot of "gristle" in your mouth. I also like that it doesn't have MSG (I'm alergic) but am disapointed that meat likely comes from outside the USA.

On taste alone, my family is split on this jerky with 2 of us liking it (me and my son) and two of us not (my wife and daughter). We all like Wild Bill's Hickory Smoked Jerky, 6.5-Ounce Package (Pack of 4).

I will not likely buy this brand again, even if it is on sale.

Label: Neutral
